 title : The fibranet Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>FibraNet is now deprecated and unmaintained. Use Fibra instead. </p>

<p>Fibranet implements a cooperative threading scheduler using Python generator functions. </p>

<p>Generator functions are wrapped in a Fibra class, which allows a thread to sleep, suspend and be killed. A Fibra can also branch into a real OS level thread if needed. </p>

<p>FibraNet is designed for use in multimedia applications which need to simulate concurrency, including games.</p>
 title : The fic Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>O FIC (Fronteiras Imaginárias Culturais) é um CMS (Content Management Systems - Sistema de gerenciamento de conteúdo) feito sob o framework CakePHP voltado inicialmente a cartografia digital. A motivação é ter um site que trabalhe as identidades culturais a partir de fronteiras reais (físicas) e imaginárias (culturais), de modo a criar novas fronteiras ou simplesmente acabar com elas. Trabalhando artisticamente o entendimento de comunidade (identidade local, regional, nacional, global) através do registro de manifestações culturais realizado por quem as vive. O software FIC busca ser um sistema ou um framework que atenda a diferentes necessidades nesse contexto.</p>

 title : The fieldtrip-project Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>BackgroundFieldtrip allows content experts to produce new online e-case studies with limited support from computer and media production specialists. The idea is based on recent developments in web technologies and how people are beginning to use the web. One of the main ideas behind the concept is that of moving away from an Internet in which the majority of users are only consumers of information (read only web), towards a new model in which the majority of users are both consumers and producers of information (read/write web). </p>

<p>HighlightsFieldtrip can be used to create a library of online case studies. Each case study includes a group of events that happened at a specific time, associated with a variety of information resources. </p>

<p>Within the case study, each event has a defined place (on a map) and a time (on a timeline) on which it occurred. The story for each event can be told through a combination of text and media elements (photos, animation, audio or video). In this way, it is possible to construct the geographic and historical context for the case study. </p>

<p>In addition, information resources can also be included to illustrate, expand, put in context or give scientific grounding to the story narrated in each event. The resources can be media, texts and hyperlinks. </p>

<p>User LevelDesigned for students, researchers and educators at the tertiary education level (graduate and post-graduate) and for professionals and practitioners. </p>

<p>Design and TechnologyRuby on Rails, Ajax, YouTube, Google Earth, Flash</p>

 title : The Nexus Web-Based Document Management Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Nexus is an open source, web-based, extensible document management system that you can install on your own host. Easy-to-use, simple to administrate and incredibly powerful, Nexus can centralize and bring order to your document library. Unlike X-Drive, Box.net and all the other hosted solutions Nexus gives you the power to deploy wherever you want leveraging existing hardware and technology. </p>

<p>The power of Nexus lies in its permissions system which applies file/folder permissions based on Nexus domains (which are made up of an Organization/Group pair). Each user is a member of a domain and therefore subject to its restrictions. </p>

<p>Nexus is built on cross-platform, open-source technology - it will run on any machine: Windows, Unix-variants, Macintosh, etc. as long as that machine has PHP 5 o</p>

 title : The fillflashdrive Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Fill Flash Drive is a script I wrote to fill a USB flash drive with random songs from a music collection.  It could be used for any device that is mountable (like mp3 players that support drag and drop/USB mass storage).   </p>

 title : The filterling Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Filterling was written to combat the spammers and increasingly prevalent ssh brute force attacks.   </p>

<p>It watches any number of logs for any number of regular expression matches.  Once a configurable threshold is reached, a user defined action occurs, like inserting a filter with pf/iptables.  After a specified amount of time has passed, the filter entry can be removed or some other user defined action can be performed. </p>

<p>You can whitelist IPs, and configure any shell command to execute instead of a filter insert/delete. </p>

<p>There is a pretty web interface (in ruby) that shows all the IPs currently blocked, their country of origin, and their country flag.  You can click on the entry to get a full whois lookup. </p>

<p>An example of the web interface is here: http://randomdynamics.com/filterling </p>

<p>I wrote this in a weekend, and updated the web stuff another day.  It&#39;s a little rough, but has been running great for over a year for me on three boxes.</p>
 title : The filth Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Filth is Second Life Open Source Combat Meter, with a new optimized communication protocol using bitecode. </p>

<p>The meter aims to give rich combat experience with the following  types of attacks: bash, stun, maim, poison, bleed, sleep, backstab, etc. (ideas mostly taken from Warcraft Dota map) </p>

<p>The meter in the future will also include aiding, hunger, money system, feeding, inventory. </p>

<p>The meter will be designed to maintain fair combat with little possibility to cheat</p>

 title : The flex-slide Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Slide is an application framework for projects built in Flex 2 or 3. </p>

<p>Key features: </p>

<p>Uses familiar design patterns Robust MVC structure View state management decoupled from view implementation Flexible approach to model and controller access, eliminating need for singleton classes. Separate view presentation from view functionality Incorporated debugging and development tools </p>

<p>Benefits: </p>

<p>Helps with project planning through visual design to production Increases the proportion of your codebase that is easily testable Makes dependencies transparent (appropriate abstraction and decoupling, not unhelpful indirection) Plays to Flex&#39;s strengths, reducing the quantity of code Encourages convention, but does not depend on it Simplifies view management</p>

 title : The flexamfphpcairngormgenerator Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>The Adobe Cairngorm MVC framework is used by many Flex developers to deliver scalable and maintainable rich internet applications.  </p>

<p>This is not the site for the core, &quot;out-of-the-box&quot; Adobe Cairngorm. Readers may visit the Adobe Labs for more information about Adobe Cairngorm MVC.  Meanwhile, the Cairngorm Extensions provided here have been open-sourced to help developers address Cairngorm implementation issues commonly encountered within enterprise RIA solutions.  </p>

<p>Extensions for Adobe CairngormThe Cairngorm Extensions are summarized below. Each link will provide details and examples of the specific extension: </p>

<p> Events Built-in support to transport responders for direct view or business logic callbacks. Implementation of AnnounceFaultEvent to allow business logic to centralize error reporting and logging. Implementation of EventGenerator to allow developers to automate dispatching of sequences of events.  Events now should self-dispatch... for direct deliver to the business/controller layer. 2) View Notification 
<br/>Built-in framework support to allow views to using proxy responders to request direct notifications to business events responses.  3) FrontControllers 
<br/>SubControllers are available so modules implemented with sub-MVC and dynamically aggregated and used within a global MVC framework. Improved error checking Ability to easily register a Function callback for any business event 4) Command Implementation 
<br/>Base class implementation Enhancements to support aggregation of event-business logic within a single Command class.  Support for the optional view notifications Best practice to deprecate Command sequencing  5) Delegate Implementation 
<br/>Base class implementation Support for easy queue of delegate calls Improved support for WebService use and WSDL errors Best practice to allow easy data transformations  Best practice to hide multiple server calls 6) ServiceLocator 
<br/>Configure services (RDS) at runtime Configure timeouts of HTTPService and WebService Universal Mind has extended the &quot;classic&quot; Adobe 2.2.x Cairngorm version to provide many productivity and maintenance enhancements. Those extensions have now been open-sourced - with BSD licensing -  to the Flex and Flash developer community. Please note that - for now - the library source code contained here (and compiled into the .swc library) actually includes the source code from the Cairngorm 2.2.1 release. Soon developers will be able to use build options to generate a CairngormExtensions.swc that does not include the core Adobe Cairngorm code. </p>

<p>Click here to read about the many Cairngorm myths that exist regarding Cairngorm and its appropriate place in developing Flex RIA solutions.  </p>

<p>Click here to read about Adobe Cairngorm and it&#39;s purposes and issues. </p>

<p>Sample Applications</p>

 title : The flexcomet Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Implementation of a Bayeux comet client in Actionscript and Flex MXML. </p>

<p>See http://cometd.org.</p>
 summary : <p>NEW AND NOTEWORTHY: Paul Barnes-Hoggett has implemented headless coverage recording with EMMA-style report output using a custom coverage agent -- see http://eyefodder.com/ for details. </p>

<p>If you are having problems, check out the FlexcoverHints page.  You can also look at the Flexcover Discussion Group (see sidebar for link), and it&#39;s a good place to post a question. </p>

<p>This project provides code coverage instrumentation, data collection and reporting tools for Adobe Flex and AIR applications. </p>

<p>Flexcover is a code coverage tool for Flex, AIR and AS3.  It incorporates a modified version of the AS3 compiler which inserts extra function calls in the code within the SWF or SWC output file. At runtime, these function calls send information on the application&#39;s code coverage to a separate tool;  The modified compiler also emits a separate &quot;coverage metadata&quot; file that describes all the possible packages, classes, functions, code blocks and lines in the code, as well as the names of the associated source code files. </p>

<p>Flexcover now computes both line coverage and branch coverage.  In branch coverage conditional code paths rather than lines are counted.  Many developers feel that branch coverage is a much more accurate measure of coverage, and it is able to detect coverage issues that occur within a single line of code such as compound conditionals with || and &amp;&amp;, or conditional expressions using the ?: operator. </p>

<p>The corresponding SDK modifications can be found in the flexcover-sdk project on Google Code. </p>

<p>Here&#39;s a screenshot: </p>

<p> </p>

<p>Flexcover is a joint effort with Alex Uhlmann of Adobe Consulting, who has been working on a related set of ideas.</p>
 title : The flexcover Open Source Project on Open Hub
 title : The flexedtoolkit Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Flexed toolkit is a set of simple components that can be easily re-used :) When I started working on Flex in 2006, I was really impressed by the framework. I have been using Flex in the project that I am working on presently. And one our goals was to build as many re-usable components so that the developers in the team do not end up re-inventing the wheel everyday. Also, its easy to deal with custom components from a maintenance perspective. </p>

<p>In this process, we learnt a lot from the community, discussion boards, mailing groups and other bloggers. flexedtoolkit is more of an effort to give it back to the community, share the knowledge we have gained and more importantly help other developers around the world save time by using the flextoolkit widgets/utilities. </p>

<p>Latest NewsFirst version of CForms released on 2nd January 2008!!! Check it out at  Flexed. The post has links to the demo and documentation. </p>

<p>Using CFormCForm reads XML file to create user entry forms. To implement CForm, the following steps are involved. </p>

<p> Developer creates XML file for each screen. The XML will contain the list of fields, controls to be used etc.  CForm is called in an MXML.  Now, the developer can use many of CForm’s exposed methods to access/manipulate data in the CForm. </p>

<p>MXML codeAS CodeTo set xml path and load CForm </p>

<p>str = “examples/cform/xmls/controls.xml”;
<br/>cfrm.widgetsFile = str;cfrm.init();To get data from CForm </p>

<p>obj = cfrm.getData(); // to get only modified values
<br/>obj = cfrm.getData(false); // to get all valuesTo reset CForm </p>

<p>cfrm.resetCForm();To set data to CForm </p>

<p>var oDataToSet:Object = new Object();
<br/>oDataToSet.fname = “udayms”;
<br/>oDataToSet.age = 27;
<br/>oDataToSet.gender = “male”;
<br/>cfrm.setData(oDataToSet);To access one field in the CForm and access properties of the widget </p>

<p>cfrm.getWidget(“fname”).getUIComponent().addEventListener();To create CForm on the fly using dynamic XML </p>

<p>cfrm.createCFormFromXML(new XML());To Validate CForm using custom validation </p>

<p>// custom validation function
<br/>private function validateForm(id:String,
<br/>value:Object, values:Object):ValidationResult{
<br/>var result:ValidationResult = new ValidationResult(false);
<br/>if(id == “txtCoName”){
<br/>if(value == “” || value == null) result = new ValidationResult(true,null,“”,
<br/>“You HAVE to enter a company name!”);
<br/>}
<br/>return result; }
<br/>// do this to actually validate the
<br/>// CForm. Internally it
<br/>// will use validateForm() method.
<br/>cfrm.validateCForm();</p>

 title : The flexfiltering Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>A project from Andy Mcintosh and John Wright to release a set of Flex controls and underlying collections to support filtering across large datasets.  The controls and collections are coded for the most part in the clean component model dictated by the OpenFlux project.   At the heart of all the controls is FilterableCollectionView, which uses a custom indexed string algorithm that is super fast compared to other AS3 filtering methods.  On top of this collection, we have built several useful controls that we are releasing in this project.</p>

 title : The flexible-js-formatting Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>This project consists of two libraries that dynamically build a formatting function for number and date formatting.  The date formatting is very similar to PHP&#39;s functionality; it also permits parsing dates.  The number formatting is similar to MS Excel formatting.  The technique of building a function to implement each formatting instruction leads to cleaner code that is richer in functionality and much faster than other popular libraries, as proven by benchmarks. </p>

<p>There is also a date chooser application (aka calendar form control) that uses the functionality provided by these libraries.  And there&#39;s a JavaScript combo box and HTML input mask. </p>

<p>The code was originally developed and hosted on http://www.xaprb.com/ but is now being hosted here so all can contribute to it.  It is now licensed under the MIT license, not the LGPL as it originally was. </p>

<p>All are invited to contribute; the original developer is very short on time, so if you want something done, please just do it yourself and don&#39;t wait for others.  Anyone who requests commit access to the Subversion repository will be granted.  Email baron.schwartz at gmail.com to request commit access. </p>

<p>Here are links to some blog posts about these functions: </p>

<p>http://www.xaprb.com/blog/2005/12/12/javascript-closures-for-runtime-efficiency/ http://www.xaprb.com/blog/2005/09/29/javascript-date-chooser/ http://www.xaprb.com/blog/2005/12/20/javascript-date-parsing/ http://www.xaprb.com/blog/2006/01/05/javascript-number-formatting/ http://www.xaprb.com/blog/2006/05/14/javascript-date-formatting-benchmarks/ http://www.xaprb.com/blog/2006/11/02/how-to-create-input-masks-in-html/ http://www.xaprb.com/blog/2005/09/29/javascript-combo-box/ Demo pages: </p>

<p>http://www.xaprb.com/articles/date-formatting-demo.html http://www.xaprb.com/articles/number-formatting-demo.html http://www.xaprb.com/articles/javascript-date-chooser-demo.html http://www.xaprb.com/html-input-mask/html-form-input-mask.html There&#39;s a github clone of the code here: </p>

<p>http://github.com/mdalessio/flexible-js-formatting/tree/master</p>
 title : The flexible-rails Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>This is a collection of helpful tools when working with Adobe Flex SDK and Rails. Some patterns adapted from Peter Armstrong&#39;s book, Flexible Rails (http://www.flexiblerails.com). </p>

<p>Installationscript/plugin install http://flexible-rails.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/plugins/flexible_rails </p>

<p>Rake Tasks Rake Tasks assumes Flex 3 SDK is your PATH  </p>

<p>rake flex              # Run all Flex tasks
<br/>rake flex:compile      # Compiles Flex Applications and moves swf(s) into public/bin directory
<br/>rake flex:static       # Moves JS, CSS, and index.html located within app/flex into respective public/ foldersGenerators./script/generate flex ApplicationName [ComponentName] </p>

<p>The first parameter specifies the ApplicationName that will be created. A Skeleton MXML file will be created in app/flex directory, as will a skeleton components directory in app/flex/com/applicationname/components. If public/bin does not exist, it will be created to hold you application SWF&#39;s </p>

<p>The second parameter specifies the name of an Application Component that will be created in app/flex/com/applicationname/components. The skeleton component will be  </p>

<p>to_xml (Fix for Flex)The to_xml() method will now by default use :dasherize =&gt; false </p>

<p>respond_torespond_to blocks in your controller will now only display .html blocks in non-production modes. This allows you to view scaffold in Development, Test, without changing your codebase in production </p>

<p>Copyright (c) 2008 Jae Hess, released under the MIT license</p>
 title : The flexigrid Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Flexigridby Paulo P. Marinas </p>

<p>Lightweight but rich data grid with resizable columns and a scrolling data to match the headers, plus an ability to connect to an xml based data source using Ajax to load the content. </p>

<p>Similar in concept with the Ext Grid only its pure jQuery love, which makes it light weight and follows the jQuery mantra of running with the least amount of configuration. </p>

<p>Features </p>

<p>Resizable columns Resizable height and width Sortable column headers Cool theme Can convert an ordinary table Ability to connect to an ajax data source (XML and JSONnew) Paging Show/hide columns Toolbar (new) Search (new) Accessible API Resizable Width JSON Support Toolbar Table Toggle Button Show/Hide Columns control have been move to the column headers (try it by mouseovering a header and clicking     a black triangle on the right) Fixed paging problem on multiple instances Mootools and Prototype noConflict() compatibility problems fixed New onError event on ajax interaction, (it will pass what the server said in a variable called data), allowing you to          handle server problems New $().flexAddData method, allows you to directly add new data to the grid using your own data source. New preProcess API, allows you to modify or process data sent by server before passing it to Flexigrid, allowing you to use your own JSON format for example. Single Rows Select just use { singleSelect: true } in the options Quick Search Many more I&#39;m planning to add an Editable and Resortable rows feature, as well as other cool GUI features. One of my main goal for the plugin is ultimately to keep it lightweight, maybe under 20k when compressed. Because otherwise you should probably stick with Ext Grid or YUI data table.</p>

 title : The flexmvcs Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>FlexMVCS is an application framework for developing Flex and ActionScript 3 projects. This is a Flex-focused modification of the excellent PureMVC framework. A significant design influence was Joe Berkovitz&#39;s MVCS approach. </p>

<p>FlexMVCS was designed and implemented by Ali Mills and Luke Bayes of Pattern Park, Inc. and was entirely funded and generously contributed to the community by Bunchball, Inc. </p>

<p>This build differs from PureMVC in the following ways: </p>

<p>Removed unnecessary use of Singletons. Added IService as a first-class participant and member of IFacade. Created asynchronous commands that trigger events when complete. Added composite command that facilitates synchronous and asynchronous command chaining with support for arbitrary composition depth. Added MXML Facade definitions. Application Facades can be defined using MXML instead of only ActionScript. Added support for Modular Flex applications, including composite Facades for each loaded module. PureMVC is trying to be more than we need, we need clean, intuitive support for Flex and ActionScript. Not ECMA, Java or other languages. Please let us know if you&#39;re interested in contributing or even using this project.</p>

 summary : <p>A Flex framework to access Ruby On Rails.</p>

 title : The flexundoredo Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Flex UndoRedo FrameworkWe at Soph-Ware Associates would like to announce the first release of the Flex UndoRedo Framework. The Flex UndoRedo Framework provides all the facilities that you need for implementing undo and redo within your applications. </p>

<p>The Flex UndoRedo Framework was built with the following goals in mind: </p>

<p>Provide a robust, extensible framework that would work without modification for basic needs Support for different groups of undo events (one group per flexMdi window for example) Allow undo and redo of an unlimited number of events Integrate cleanly and transparently into applications with or without Cairngorm The Flex UndoRedo Framework is an open source project available for all to use. For more information, please see the links in the sidebar. </p>

<p>With CairngormThe Cairngorm release builds provides a lightweight but extensible framework for handling undo and redo. </p>

<p>As we have now been through a few iterations with the undo framework, we believe that it provides a solid 1.0 release. If you have thoughts or suggestions, we would love to hear about them. </p>

<p>Without CairngormWe have recently created a fork of the UndoRedo Framework that does NOT use Cairngorm.  Rather, it provides the same undo stack and undo group facilities but uses a different base class and a separate (but identical) interface so that it can easily be integrated into non-Cairngorm projects. </p>

<p>You can download the most recent version of the Flex UndoRedo Framework not requiring Cairngorm from the downloads area or the featured downloads sidebar. </p>

<p>Commercial FriendlyAlthough we started out with a GPL license, we&#39;ve changed our license to the Apache License in order to be friendly to our commercial users.  A sincere thank you to everyone who requested this change. </p>

<p>Please let us know how of your successes, failures or of anything relevant you think we should know.</p>

 title : The flexxb Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>FlexXB is an open source library for Adobe Flex/Air applications that provides annotation based marshalling/un-marshalling of Flash objects in order to facilitate data communication between Flex UI and backend servers or to process various content. It offers a built-in xml handling mechanism.</p>

<p>FlexXB is now serialization format agnostic and allows users to extend the engine and add support for different serialization formats (JSON, etc) while still sharing the base features such as object caching, circular reference handling, constructor annotations, id fields, version extraction. The advantage is that the base features are integrated by default with the new serialization context that defines the new format and one should only care about the actual AS3 object - ? conversions.</p>
 title : The flibble Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>High-level Java API for easily creating SIP enabled VoIP applications.  Suitable for either a desktop (softphone, phone applet, incoming call screener) or server-side (auto attendant, ACD, voicemail) application.  Defines a generic media provider interface, and includes an implementation of that interface which uses the Java Media Framework. Flibble-VoIP is the underlying engine of the VoxCenter softphone </p>

<p>NEWS 6/11/2008 - Flibble-VoIP Beta 2 has been released. In addition to the addition of the roadmap items below, many fixes were made to STUN, SIP Signaling, media, DTMF, and authentication.  Tested with Vonage, VoIP.com, Broad Voice, and IdeaSIP.  </p>

 title : The flightaf Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Flight Application FrameworkFlight AF is a light-weight and powerful Flex application framework. Great concern and care has gone into the crafting of it to keep it from requiring unnecessary busy work. </p>

<p>Flight AF is one of the first (if not THE first) Flash frameworks with a full undo-redo framework out of the box. Weighing in at 7.8KB and providing an easy and solid way to organize your Flex application, Flight AF makes programming Flex enjoyable and maintainable. </p>

<p>For more information see A Brief Overview of Flight Application Framework</p>
 title : The flint-cms Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Flint: a simple Grok-based CMSFlint is a pragmatic and light-weight CMS based on Grok which is useful out-of-the-box, allows trivial customizations to be done trivially, but showcases Grok best practices and therefore leverages the flexibility and pluggability of the Zope Component Architecture to allow deep customization and extension.  </p>

<p>In order to be immediately useful, Flint follows the Plone lead by providing ready to use content management and public interfaces. However, Flint&#39;s content management interface is not embedded in the public interface, for two reasons: to make it easier to customize one interface without touching the other, and to avoid a single-hierarchy mindset which is detrimental to current content management best practices. </p>

<p>Besides Plone, Flint is inspired by three other pragmatic and light-weight CMSs which aim for flexibility while remaining easy to learn: Radiant (Ruby on Rails, see http://radiantcms.org/), Página-1 (a pre-CMF Zope Based CMS developed by Hiperlógica), and  Django, which although is not a CMS comes quite close with it&#39;s powerful and ready to use admin interface.  </p>

<p>To learn more about Flint, check our Wiki Index</p>
 title : The Flint particles Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Flint is an open-source project to create a versatile particle system in Actionscript 3. The aim is to create a library that handles the common functionality for all particle systems, has methods for common particle behaviours, and lets developers extend it easily with their own custom behaviours without needing to touch the core code. </p>

<p>You can find more about Flint and join in discussions on our forum at the Flint website - http://flintparticles.org/</p>
 title : The flisp Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>SWF files commonly consume XML in order to define their data at runtime; however, algorithms are almost always baked into the Actionscript code at compile time and leave the coder no options at runtime.</p>

<p>Flisp classes, when compiled into a Flash project, will allow that project to optionally pull in strings of Scheme code at runtime and have them execute either once or as part of a clip&#39;s onEnterFrame function. Thus, the XML can contain not only static pieces of data such as &#39;starting_y=&quot;122&quot;&#39; but also algorithmic information like &#39;enterFrameLisp=&quot;(+ _y 1)&quot;&#39;, all as attributes within an XML node.</p>

<p>Lisp is chosen for the pure simplicity of its syntax, which among other things makes it possible to parse quickly into trees of objects. Also, in all honesty I&#39;m working my way through the MIT Structure and Interpretation of Computer Programs course and view this as a chance to develop in two directions at once.</p>

<p>However, first and foremost it&#39;s born of necessity: I&#39;m making a game engine that creates all its entities from XML nodes, and don&#39;t want to subclass every time I need a slightly different movement algorithm.</p>
 title : The flo2d Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>flo2d is a 2-dimensional flow and adjoint solver for inviscid and viscous fluids. It solves the Euler and Navier-Stokes equations on unstructured triangular grids using a vertex-centroid finite volume scheme. The adjoint solver is developed using the automatic differentiation tool TAPENADE. At present, only the flow solver is available, which is furthermore only for laminar flows. </p>

<p>flo2d is a further development of euler2d, which is a 2-D inviscid flow and adjoint solver. See the euler2d website </p>

<p>Some featuresInviscid and viscous (laminar only at present) Finite volume method Cell-centered scheme Triangular grids (only) Second order scheme (MUSCL-type) Roe, KFVS Explicit TVD-RK, LUSGS, GMRES (full newton using AD)</p>

 title : The flosc Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Based on the original bridge developed by Ben Chun that you can find at http://www.benchun.net/flosc/ and the AS Classes from Fwiidom.org by Adam Robertson </p>

<p>An AS3 library that communicates with a &quot;Flosc server&quot; to enable flash apps to get OSC information </p>

<p>If you are looking for Tuio communication then apart from this library you&#39;ll need the tuio-as3-lib </p>

<p>For mac users:Use Oscar for an UDP-to-XML Use memo.tv udp-tcp-bridge for a binary socket instead last change on repository (21/09/2009):Added TCP connection to use with http://code.google.com/p/udp-tcp-bridge/  </p>

<p>The TCP Connection class is based on the one provided by Dean North at http://www.touchgateway.com/ </p>

 title : The fluentjava Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>News11/05/2009: fluentjava 0.3 Released. </p>

<p>The whole EnumerationProtocol was implemented, as you can see here, with a little closure coercion as well. Fluent Sets, Fluent Maps and Fluent lists can be easily be created from other collections libraries. Lazy methods on enumeration protocol, so that you can cascade, filter, map, take and only invoke the actual closures when you actually need the result. And much more. </p>

<p>Get started here. </p>

<p>IntroductionProject that attempts to reduce the verbosity, lack of fluency and unfriendly interface that is common to several tasks in Java, such as: </p>

<p>Blocks of code manipulation (Closures) Collection manipulation Reflection Input/Output Raw Type conversion Next few StepsReally planned list Deprecated as 14/01/2010 by Mark Reinhold&#39;s assertion that lambda expressions or even full blown closures will be brought to java7. Ok, evidences are (here, here and here): java 7 will very likely not have closures, which made me reconsider adding it to this project, while making it backwards compatible with all the bringing closure to java attempts. Automatic object to Closure coercion is vital to this, and little AOP can make it even more fluent.  New File-like returning reades/writers, streams, and ExtendedIterators for paths and lines of content for simple files/Files for directories (many features are already included on commons-io, but all as top-level functions). Fluent style. Make Files a Composite: File-like structure composed of folders and files. Mirror getting Maps as input/output Mirror being able to convert types like Spring does on its IoC Fluent output. System.out just doesn&#39;t cut. Also use Xstream to allow output of any object in XML format. Generic Decorators that turn any object into Serializable (via Xstream in the generic case) and Comparables (receiving Comparators) Create Order objects, which require only lessThanMethod to be implemented (no more 0, -1 or negative, or +1 or positive that Comparators need). Comparator built from Orders. Inspiration: Python. General ConceptsA few links to clear things up. </p>

<p>Fluent Style and DSLs: http://martinfowler.com/dslwip/ http://martinfowler.com/bliki/FluentInterface.html Closures:  Article that introduces closures and its uses, using apache commons:  http://www.ibm.com/developerworks/library/j-fp.html Martin Fowler&#39;s post on the uses of closures and collections: http://martinfowler.com/bliki/CollectionClosureMethod.html No closures in java: http://weblogs.java.net/blog/brucechapman/archive/2008/03/anouncement_no.html Enumerable in ruby: How closures are usefull. Scala also has its own  enumeration protocol. Closures in Smalltalk: where all the oo + functional rage began. Also, they are called blocks here.  Functional java is a project that aims to prepare the Java programming language for the inclusion of closures, and would benefit from java incorporating the BGGA implementation. Groovy also makes good use of it. No need to wait for closures on java to use the project above. It is not pure java though. Fork join javadoc: filter, map, find, etc. Not only are they usefull for expressing, but IBM has made it clear that they work very well with closures, and are great at making common tasks trivally parallel. Unlike closures, this made through the cut into java 7. Similar ProjectsApache Commons (formerly known as Jarkata Commons): similar feature-wise mostly to the features encompassed by commons lang, commons io and commons collections. Jaggregate: great project of Smalltalk-like collections. The project has its downfalls though, such as using Java collections classes names, which can be confusing. Generic algorithmns for java: closure api to Java. Still not as terse as real smtalltalk, python, ruby or scheme&#39;s syntax, but provides quite a few  pre-made closures. Google collections: also provides some closures, not as much as jga. Has several kinds of collections though, and several utility methods on them as well. Hamcrest Collections: very fluent interface for collections. Development is still at the beginning, and uses a lot of Global Scoping technique, which mostly comes from Hamcrest. http://functionalj.sourceforge.net/: Another project that tries to bring functional programming to java world. Yeah google did it a long time ago, and Hadoop did it again. Yes, map and reduce are functional concepts. gparallelizer By using Groovy, it wrapps around Fork-join and make it more usable.</p>

 title : The flvmeta Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>FLVmeta aims to be a replacement for tools such as flvtool2. </p>

<p>It is able to inject all known metadata tags into the onMetaData event, as well as insert an onLastSecond event. </p>

<p>Since version 1.0.7, it is also able to fix very large FLV files with invalid 24-bit timestamps to make proper use of 32-bit extended timestamps. </p>

<p>FLVmeta is written in portable C, it can therefore be compiled on a variety of platforms, including Linux, Windows, and MacOSX. It is also fast and has a very small memory footprint.</p>

 title : The flyspeck Open Source Project on Open Hub
 title : The flyweights Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Flyweights are small handle classes for immutable data that intelligently share their content to prevent memory duplication. The Flyweight class has been designed as simply as possible and can be used as a drop-in replacement for T. </p>

<p>ProblemImagine an application that has hundreds or thousands of users. Each user has a first and last name, stored as separate strings in memory. It is highly likely that some of them share the same first or last names; if there are 20 people with the first name &quot;Richard&quot; then 20 duplicate instances of &quot;Richard&quot; will exist in memory. </p>

<p>SolutionThe best way to demonstrate how Flyweights can address this problem is with a very simple example: </p>

<p>Flyweight a = &quot;Richard&quot;;
<br/>Flyweight b = &quot;Richard&quot;;
<br/>Flyweight c = &quot;Richard&quot;;
<br/>Flyweight d = &quot;Richard&quot;;
<br/>Flyweight e = &quot;Richard&quot;;With regular System.String objects, five separate copies of &quot;Richard&quot; would exist concurrently, even though they are all identical. Flyweights can detect this, and will only store one object in memory. </p>

<p>DocumentationFlyweight details and examples UnsafeFlyweight details and examples Design and rationale Extending the library Acknowledgements DownloadThe Flyweights source is currently available in SVN, or via the downloads page. </p>

<p>Requirements.NET framework 2.0 or higher.</p>

 title : The fnordbot Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>FnordBotFnordbot started out as a simple client for testing my chat-algorithms, but evolved into an extensible IRC bot, based upon a layered IRC protocol framework suitable for implementing other clients. The bot runs as a windows service, and a NSIS installer is included. </p>

<p>LibIrc2LibIrc2 is a layered IRC protocol framework. You can decide how much of the framework to use: </p>

<p>Network layer contains simple methods for sending and receiving data from the server. Protocol layer contains logic for parsing received data as IRC messages and for sending IRC commands. Client layer adds an object model of joined channels and their users </p>

<p>PluginsSeveral plugins are included in the base distribution: </p>

<p>Logger - for logging to disk Sortsnak - Non-Intelligent, Artificial Language Learner-style chatbot. Inspired by Monty the PIRC-bot Stat - maintains statistics on most active users and most used words  Wordgame - a word guessing game, inspired by the eggdrop script of the same name. Voter - Hold a referendum in a channel</p>
 title : The fnshortener Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Some MP3 mobile players only show a very limited number of directories when using the FAT16 file system. This behavior sometimes can be improved by not using file- and directory-names longer than 12 characters. (8.3 format, see http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File_Allocation_Table for more information). </p>

<p>fnshortener (file name shortener) will do this job automatically for you. </p>

<p>BIG FAT WARNING: Always double check which path you give as an argument to fnshortener. Every file and directory will be renamed. Even if there is no MP3-file in it at all. This can </p>

<p>destroy your file-system (Windows) destroy the names of your wonderful arranged home-directory (Linux) destroy the wonderful names of your MP3 files in your original MP3 collection. So only rename copies of your MP3 collection. </p>

<p>System Requirementsfnshortener is programmed in Java, so be sure you have a recent Java VM (at least 6). You aren&#39;t sure? Go to http://www.java.com </p>

<p>It is also a commandline/shell program. No nice graphical interface (GUI) yet. </p>

<p>MP3 playersA (veeery short) list of MP3-players is in the WIKI.</p>

<p>On top of that, FOAM is intended to be: </p>

<p>* portable: it should run on many (unix like) systems,
<br/>* scalable: it will provide scalability through threading in crucial parts, 
<br/>* open source: the source will be open and well documented, such that it can be easily developed by someone else.</p>

 summary : <p>BackgroundFoodr was created to ease organization of food orders and automate notifications for all participants. In a busy corporation, people often doesn&#39;t have time or interest in lurking throughout the city in a search for food. They also doesn&#39;t like to stay hungry till the end of workday. So the more or less spontaneous actions are undertaken by members of a hungry team to call for pizza or some other meal. This results in chaos, as they have no reliable and non-intrusive (no more food spam) way to coordinate their effort. And then comes Foodr. </p>

 title : The foogoo2 Open Source Project on Open Hub
 title : The foom Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Foom was designed with a few core ideas.  </p>

<p>·       It must have C-style syntax.  For better or worse, many of today’s programming languages have derived or borrowed aspects of their syntax from C. Doing so decreases the learning curve allowing broader adoption of the language. </p>

<p>·       Everything is an object. Most programming languages have a set of primitive data types such as strings, integers, floating point numbers, and Boolean values.  In Foom, all of these, with the addition of functions and types, are classes. They all have properties that can be accessed and manipulated. </p>

<p>·       All curly brackets ({ }) are anonymous functions. This is a departure from C-style syntax to some extent.  C uses curly brackets to limit scope and define blocks of code. Foom follows this convention; however, code within bare curly brackets is not executed until it is called, as it is a function. </p>

<p>·       Variables are lexically-scoped.  The context of a variable can be found by reading the text of the program and noting the location of the declaration. </p>

<p>·       Functions are first-class objects.  As mentioned above, functions are objects, which can be passed to other functions and stored in data structures.  They can also be created by other functions encapsulating their scope producing what is called a closure. </p>

<p>  </p>

<p>See more in Foom Documentation. </p>

<p>Quicksort (tests\qsort.fm): </p>

<p>foom.import(&quot;sys&quot;);
<br/>list data = [3,1,20,4,7,2];</p>

<p>func printlist = {
<br/>  list l = args[0];
<br/>  sys.print(&quot;[&quot;);
<br/>  for(int i = 0; i &lt; l.length; i = i + 1) {
<br/>    sys.print(l[i]);
<br/>    if(i &lt; l.length - 1)
<br/>      sys.print(&quot;, &quot;);
<br/>  }
<br/>  sys.println(&quot;]\n&quot;);
<br/>};
<br/>func swap = {
<br/>  list l = args[0];
<br/>  int t = l[args[1]];
<br/>  l[args[1]] = l[args[2]];
<br/>  l[args[2]] = t;
<br/>  l;
<br/>};</p>

<p>func sort = {
<br/>  list d = args[0];
<br/>  int b = args[1];
<br/>  int e = args[2];
<br/>  if(e &gt; b + 1) {
<br/>    int piv = d[b];
<br/>    int l = b + 1;
<br/>    int r = e;
<br/>    for(0;l &lt; r;0) {
<br/>      if(d[l] &lt;= piv) {
<br/>        l = l + 1;
<br/>      } else {
<br/>        r = r - 1;
<br/>        swap(d, l, r);
<br/>      }
<br/>    }
<br/>    l = l - 1;
<br/>    swap(d, l, b);
<br/>    sort(d, b, l);
<br/>    sort(d, r, e);
<br/>  }
<br/>};</p>

<p>printlist(data);
<br/>sort(data, 0, data.length);
<br/>printlist(data);Produces: </p>

<p>foom tests/qsort.fm 
<br/>[3, 1, 20, 4, 7, 2]</p>

<p>[1, 2, 3, 4, 7, 20]</p>
 title : The foomonger Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>The Foomonger ActionScript Package is a collection of utilities I&#39;ve created to address my regular coding needs.  I tried to only include code that hasn&#39;t been created before (or at least not available outside of a heavy framework). </p>

Always finding yourself loading a bunch of files and thinking there must be a better way to track the load progress? Are you trying to load more files than the browser can handle at once and find that your progress bar jumps back and forth? Check out the LoadWatcher class. ASDocs </p>

 title : The forhire Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Introductionforhire will draw a client into a domain, and they will ask for a quote on a project.  That domain&#39;s associate will sub out the parts of the project that they cannot complete themselves to associates (either within the forhire system or independents).  Quotes will be gathered and merged by the leading associate for presentation to the client.  If the client accepts the invoice, payment (or a pre-determined percentage of the full payment) will be made via Credit Card to Paypal and distributed to the parties involved with the project the client has requested.  All associates will complete their tasks to receive the full payment and have the project added to their portfolio, and the associates will be added to one another&#39;s associates list.  Associates will then be rated both by the client (anonymously) and each other in their level of competence in the area of skill that they used in the completion of the project. </p>

<p>System OutlineStandard Information Displayed on a Domain for Anonymous Visitors </p>

<p>Contact Form Portfolio Project Detail Pages References About Pages Mission Statement Associates (Resumes) References Addresses and Telephone Numbers Gallery Tour of Facilities Associates Professional Blog </p>

<p>In-Depth Information For Clients </p>

<p>Client Login Sales Inquiry Form Support Request Form Invoice negotiations between lead Associate and Clients </p>

<p>In-Dept Information for Associates </p>

<p>Associate Login Manage Standard information displayed to visitors Manage Content retrieved by the anonymous visitor&#39;s form -&gt; create new clients Negotiate with clients for settled invoice Ask for bids from other associates Bid on work offers from other associates Settled Invoice becomes a project and will eventually be included in the Portfolio </p>

<p>Simple Bookkeeping </p>

<p>Clients Pay by Paypal Website Hosting Paid by Paypal Fees paid to Associates via PayPal </p>

<p>Technical Specificationsforhire should be designed to handle multiple domain names from a single code base.  Each of these domains belong to one Associate (the cost of hosting the system of sites should be distributed evenly among associates based upon their level of use their domain contributes to the total hosting cost of the system of sites--  </p>

<p>( a domain&#39;s usage ) * ( sitewide cost ) / ( sitewide uses ) = cost of a domain&#39;s hostingRuby on Rails will allow this software to be deployed on a Joyent Accelerator or within the Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud.</p>
 title : The form-mail-cakephp-plugin Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>GitHubに移行しました http://github.com/slywalker/form_mail/tree/master </p>

<p>/app/plugins/form_mail/config/database.sql </p>

 title : The form-spam-protection Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Tired of forms in your web application getting spammed?  Captcha works but is a pain.  This plugin ensures a real person is submitting the form without requiring anything from the user except that they have Javascript turned on. </p>

<p>This plugin uses the Hivelogic Enkoder, normally used to protect spambots from harvesting e-mail addresses, to enkode a hidden field on the form.  That field is required when the user submits the form or they get an error. </p>

<p>To install: ./script/plugin install -x http://form-spam-protection.googlecode.com/svn/form_spam_protection/</p>
 title : The form-test-helper Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>form-test-helper has gone on to a better placeform-test-helper was first released in September of 2006.  At the time, it represented a significant step forward in testing apps with the full rails stack.  I haven&#39;t updated it in quite some time, and I&#39;m happy to see that some other tools came along and built on form-test-helper&#39;s ideas.  Go check out webrat and read The Rspec Book to learn about the latest Rails tools in this vein. -- Jason Garber </p>

<p>--- </p>

<p>This plugin uses assert_select to verify and manipulate your forms.  It solves the problem we&#39;ve all run into where you change the form but the test doesn&#39;t break because you&#39;re just passing parameters to an action.   </p>

<p>Instead of this: post :create, :book =&gt; {:name =&gt; &#39;Pickaxe&#39;, :category =&gt; 1, :out_of_print =&gt; 0} </p>

<p>This plugin lets you do this: </p>

<p>get :new
<br/>submit_form do |form|
<br/>  form.book.name = &#39;Pickaxe&#39;
<br/>  form.book.category = &#39;Programming&#39;
<br/>  form.book.out_of_print.uncheck
<br/>end
<br/>assert_response :successSee the README file for more examples. </p>

<p>InstallationTo install for Rails Edge (revisions 7420 and higher) use trunk:./script/plugin install -x http://form-test-helper.googlecode.com/svn/form_test_helper/ </p>

<p> Requires Rails trunk revision 7420 and higher  </p>

<p>To install for Rails Edge where the edge revision ranges from 6764 to 7420 use the 1.1.1 tag:./script/plugin install http://form-test-helper.googlecode.com/svn/tags/form_test_helper-1.1.1 </p>

<p> Requires a Rails Edge revision inside of the range of 6764 and 7420)  </p>

<p>To install for Rails 1.2.x use the 1.0.0 tag:./script/plugin install http://form-test-helper.googlecode.com/svn/tags/form_test_helper-1.0.1 </p>

<p> Requires Rails 1.2.x and higher (up to Rails Edge revision 6763)  </p>

<p>RdocRdoc documentation for each &quot;branch&quot; are being hosted at rubyforge. </p>

<p>For form_test_helper edge: http://continuous.rubyforge.org/form_test_helper/rdoc/ </p>

<p>For form_test_helper 1.1.x: http://continuous.rubyforge.org/form_test_helper-1.1.x/rdoc/ </p>

<p>For form_test_helper 1.0.x: http://continuous.rubyforge.org/form_test_helper-1.0.x/rdoc/</p>

 title : The fortunata Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>The development of Semantic Web Applications is hard. Meanwhile using Jena, Sesame, or any other Java library to create your first experiments is relatively easy, the next step, building useful Semantic Web Applications is too complex for the average developer. You have to deal with web servers and web-client technologies, and join all this with your application code. </p>

<p>Wiki technologies provide a simple syntax to create the web-client, and some wikis let developers to extend its functionality by means of plugins. </p>

<p>We exploit these plugins to provide developers with a Java library named Fortunata that joins all the best of a concrete wiki (JSPWiki), Jena, and a web server (Apache Tomcat) in order to simplify the creation process of Semantic Web Applications. </p>

<p>I hope you enjoy. </p>

<p>-Mariano</p>

 title : The foxify-fixtures-plugin Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Foxify Fixtures plugin for Rails(See original blog post: http://edgenic.com/2008/06/11/foxify-fixtures-plugin-refactor-those-old-fixtures-to-make-them-foxy) </p>

<p>Foxify fixtures refactors your Rails application test fixtures by changing all id-based references to name-based references (see http://ryandaigle.com/articles/2007/10/26/what-s-new-in-edge-rails-fixtures-just-got-a-whole-lot-easier). It should work on both regular Test fixtures as well as Rspec  fixtures. </p>

<p>The plugin assumes that various conventions are followed, for instance: </p>

<p>all foreign keys end with &#39;id&#39; class names are the &quot;camelized&quot;, singular form of the table names   Given these assumptions, Foxify fixtures may not work if your models and relationships deviate from the default Rails way of doing things. </p>

<p>One caveat: This plugin only &quot;foxifies&quot; the actual fixture .yml files themselves. If your tests access the fixtures based on ID&#39;s, those will have to be manually refactored to access the fixtures based on names. </p>

<p>UsageAlthough the plugin will try to back up your fixtures into a directory named &#39;backup&#39; where your fixtures are located, it&#39;s a good idea to back up your app  before running the plugin. </p>

<p>Run as follows: </p>

<p>rake db:fixtures:foxify 
<br/>TroubleshootingFoxify fixtures relies upon the associations an app has defined in it&#39;s  models. If an association is missing, for example having a &#39;has_many :books&#39;  association in your Author model, but missing the respective  &#39;belongs_to :author&#39; in your Book model, the you&#39;ll get an error message  telling you what foreign key is missing the association. It&#39;s also possible  that the plugin will incorrectly complain about your associations, if they  don&#39;t follow the default Rails conventions. </p>

<p>Copyright (c) 2008 Bruz Marzolf, released under the MIT license</p>
 title : The fpfd Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>An implementation of the IEEE 754-2008 decimal arithmetic specifications. FPFD is designed to implement both decimal encodings specified in 754-2008, DPD (Densely-Packed-Decimal) and so-called BID (Binary-Integer-Decimal). The implementation is designed to be fast, with a mixed assembly-language and C implementation of a C interface resembling that of MPFR (http://www.mpfr.org). One main goal of FPFD is to determine which encoding is faster, on a variety of platforms.</p>

It&#39;s very easy to use - use two fingers (&quot;pinch&quot;) for zooming, moving and even rotating the fractal (note the &quot;and&quot;!), or drag a control point to change proportions/angles. </p>

 title : The fragmentron Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Mnesia is Erlang&#39;s built-in distributed database.  It provides primitives for adding nodes to the database set and to manage fragments, but does not prescribe any high-level strategies. </p>

<p>Fragmentron provides one strategy for automatically distributing data as nodes are added and removed from the system.  This simplifies Mnesia administration in a dynamic environment, e.g., EC2. </p>

<p>gen_herd is a generalization of the fragmentron strategy to arbitrary Erlang processes, intended for partitioned services that need to be automatically (re)distributed across a computing cluster. </p>

<p>Another Dukes of Erl release.</p>
 title : The framecalixto Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Frame Calixto </p>

<p>Este framework foi baseado inicialmente na estrutura MVC, onde foi incrementado a separação da camada de negócio e a camada de internacionalização, tornando-se assim um framework &#39;n&#39; camadas. </p>

<p>Procurei separar de forma simples a estrutura das entidades e guardá-las separadas por diretório e definidas em um arquivo XML.  </p>

<p>Este framework tem a responsabilidade de ler estes XMLs e a inteligência de apresentar  a entidade em HTML e armazenar suas informações em um banco de dados. </p>

<p>Referente aos arquivos de cada entidade, procurei armazená-los de forma organizada  e juntos para facilitar o reaproveitamento de programas. </p>

<p>O framework possui também um gerador de cadastros, e a possíbilidade de utilização  de um controle de acesso e um controle de menus. </p>

<p>A instalação atualmente está sendo pensada, futuramente estarei criando um instalador para o framework.</p>

 title : The freebase-python Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Freebase.com has an open API that can be used to access and update structured data. The RESTful http-based API is completely documented at Freebase.com along with some simple examples. This library provides a python interface to that API. </p>

<p>Usage should be as simple as: </p>

<p>&gt;&gt;&gt; import freebase
<br/>&gt;&gt;&gt; freebase.mqlread({&quot;id&quot;: &quot;/en/david_bowie&quot;, &quot;name&quot;: None})
<br/>{u&#39;id&#39;: u&#39;/en/david_bowie&#39;, u&#39;name&#39;: u&#39;David Bowie&#39;}For more information, see GettingStarted. </p>

<p>This library also provides a number of command-line utilities and APIs for creating, dumping, and reloading schema to make it easy to programatically create schema and move schema from sandbox-freebase.com to freebase.com. For more on this see the recipes pages. </p>

<p>Discussion of this project is hosted at Freebase developers mailing list. </p>

<p>Installing is easy, if you have easy_install, just say </p>

<p>$ easy_install freebasefreebase-python will use the jsonlib2 library if it is already installed, and otherwise will fall back to using the json (Python 2.6+) or simplejson (Python 2.5 and below) modules. </p>

<p>If you don&#39;t have easy_install, you can get it by running http://peak.telecommunity.com/dist/ez_setup.py</p>

 title : The freedots Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Freedots allows a blind user to view a MusicXML file using braille music notation. Playback of a complete score and individual parts via MIDI is also supported. Additionally, minor editing functionality is included and changes are saved in MusicXML format. This makes it possible for a blind users to use freedots together with optical music recognition software. </p>

 title : The freemium Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>FreemiumThe Freemium plugin attempts to encapsulate the Right Way to offer service subscriptions. It is built to handle multiple subscription plans (free, premium, premium plus, etc.), let you control your own invoices, and to interact with any merchant gateway that supports either automated recurring billing or credit card storage. </p>

<p>Freemium is a different beast from ActiveMerchant. Where the latter is optimized for one-off billing of credit cards (as in a retail environment), Freemium is optimized for storage and recurring billing of credit cards. This makes it a much cleaner and more complete solution for handling subscriptions. At the time of this writing, however, Freemium actually depends on ActiveMerchant because of its excellent CreditCard model, which I plan to steal. </p>

<p>This plugin was born out of my attempts to figure out the correct way to handle subscriptions. I decided that the safest/cleanest way was to simply keep track of how far out the subscription had been paid, and when that date came near, bill the subscription again to extend the paid_through date. The approach has turned out well, I think, though I strongly encourage anyone and everyone to review the processes in this plugin to make sure the assumptions it makes are appropriate. </p>

<p>Please see http://freemium.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/README for more information, including instructions for installation.</p>

It is usable in all server and client side environments (ASP.NET, ASP, PHP, CF, JSP, Ruby, etc.)</p>
 title : The freetms Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>FreeTMSOverviewFreeTMS is an open source, standards compliant petroleum terminal management system (TMS) and automation system (TAS).   The main benefits over a commercial TMS/TAS package are: </p>

<p>Standards Compliance -- We will be able to import and export data as PIDEX, SAP IDocs, Petroex, ExSTARS, and TABS. Source Code Availability -- Some of the benefits of having the source code include: The ability to perform in-house maintainence (changes). The ability to see &#39;under the hood&#39;.   Flexible Licensing -- Flexible GNU Licence.  The customer can change .  You can &#39;Under the hood&#39; visibility -- Any code quality issues or defects are visible unlike non-free, closed source systems.  Unlike with proprietary software, you will be able to audit FreeTMS for security and quality. Goals for First ReleaseModel the petroleum terminal management business in a proper RDBMS (like PostgreSQL). Design interfaces for importing data into our datamodel with concentration on PIDEX, PetroEx, and SAP IDOCs. Develop reports (as views). Design interfaces for hardware meters and load controllers (like Accuload and Multiload). Implement a sriptable loading process using a language like TCL, lisp, or Python. Integrate &#39;pretty&#39; reporting system like Crystal Reports or Jasper Reports. Incorporate graphical user interface (using GTK+). All of this should run under Unix (FreeBSD, Solaris, &amp; Linux) and use the GNU toolchain.  Support for the Sun Studio compiler should be included.</p>

 title : The freetuxtv Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Warning : A new blog is now avaliable. The channel playlists can be found in the download section and packages are also avaliable from my web site. Eric. </p>

<p>The goal of this project is to create a WebTV player, working on the Linux platform. It can be used by french people to watch ADSL TV on the PC with ISPs Free and SFR. The GUI is developed in GTK2+ and is using the VLC engine to display the channels. </p>

<p>Features : </p>

<p>Play TV : French ISP : Free, SFR, Orange, Alice, Bouygues...  Web TV : Arabic, Chinese, English, French, German, Italian, Japanese, Portuguese, Russian, Spain Web Radio : English, French, German  Play in full screen mode and miniature mode More than 150 logos of TV channels Support for multimedia keys Add new groups of channels from M3U playlists Recording live channels </p>

<p>Programming Record Time shifting Program Management TV  Multi platform support </p>

<p>To follow the progress of the project, subscribe to the RSS feed blog (in french) :  </p>

<p>FreetuxTV is now available in stable version. Go to the Downloads section to get it. The latest stable version 0.4.2 is available since the March 14th 2010. You can also read the ChangeLog for a list of new features. </p>

<p>There are three ways to install it: </p>

<p>Download and compile the source package: http://code.google.com/p/freetuxtv/downloads/list Download the packages for your distribution: http://freetuxtv.eric-beuque.com/packages/ Use the official Ubuntu repository : https://launchpad.net/~freetuxtv/+archive/freetuxtv At this moment, only the Ubuntu, Mandriva and openSUSE packages are available. We are looking for people to manage packages for other distributions. </p>

<p>FreetuxTV is also available in development version. You can install and use it with no problem for watching television with latest features. See the README file to know how to install it. </p>

<p>You can also contribute to the project. Have a look at the Wiki. </p>

 title : The friendster-rails-api Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Rails plugin to develop applications to the Friendster platform. This plugin supports the following APIs: </p>

<p>/token POST Create a new token that can be exchanged for a session after the user logs in.  /session POST Create a new API Session.  /user GET Get User Information for the logged in user.  /user/:uids GET Get User Information for users in :uids list.  /application/friends GET Get friends who also installed the current application.  /fans/:uid GET Get a fan profile&#39;s fan list.  /friends/:uid GET Get user&#39;s friend list.  /depth/:uid1,:uid2 GET Get relation depth (distance) between two users.  /photos/:uid GET Get user&#39;s photos.  /photos/ GET Get photos for the current logged in user.  /photos/:uid POST Uploads a photo for the specified user.  /photos/ POST Uploads a photo for the current logged in user.  /photo/:uid/:pid GET Get a user&#39;s photo.  /photo/:pid GET Get a photo for the current logged in user.  /photo/:pid PUT Modify photo attributes.  /primaryphoto/:uid GET Get a user&#39;s primary photo.  /primaryphoto/ GET Get the primary photo for the current logged in user.  /photo/:pid DELETE Deletes a user&#39;s photos.  /albums/:uid GET Gets the user&#39;s albums.  /albums/ GET Gets the current user&#39;s albums.  /album/ POST Creates an album.  /album/:aid DELETE Deletes an album.  /shoutout/:uid GET Get a user&#39;s shoutout  /shoutout/ GET Get the shoutout for the current user.  /shoutout/ POST Update a user&#39;s shoutout.  /widget POST Update widget&#39;s profile content for the logged in user.  /widget GET Get widget content and title for the logged in user.  /notification POST Post a notification</p>

 title : The Fritzing Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Fritzing is an open-source initiative to support designers and artists to take the step from physical prototyping to actual product. We are aiming to create a software in the spirit of Processing and Arduino, that allows the designer/artist/researcher/hobbyist to document their Arduino-based prototype and create a PCB layout for manufacturing. The complimenting website helps to share and discuss drafts and experiences as well as to reduce manufacturing costs. </p>

<p>Fritzing will essentially be an Electronic Design Automation software with a low entry barrier, suited for the needs of designers and artists. It will use the metaphor of the breadboard, so that it will be easy to transfer your hardware sketch to the software. From there it will be possible to export CAD files ready to be sent to a</p>

 title : The frogger-game Open Source Project on Open Hub

It uses STL, OpenGL/GLUT, OpenAL and DevIL (older OpenIL), so, it should run everywhere these libraries are implemented.  title : The frontnote Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>FrontNote is designed to be a full office-class note-taking replacement application. Long term goals for FrontNote include: </p>

<p>-A multi-platform GUI (Java) capable of synchronizing with a user&#39;s online note repository. + Automatic synchronization between the user&#39;s computer and the online repository when an internet connection is detected. + SVN/CVS-style version control for individual note sheets. -A web 2.0 (ajax, ruby) interface capable of handling and storing both text and tablet pen input. -Abstract composition of the user&#39;s note repository, allowing for simple scalability (i.e., one note sheet compiled to a multi-user note project). -User friendly note repository sharing features, including access permission considerations. </p>

<p>FrontNote is geared toward a business worker or student who requires on-the-fly access to his/her note repository, usable in any computing situation (text/pen input, online/offline, browser/standalone). FrontNote is designed with usability, speedy data access, and ease of data entry as highest priorities. </p>

<p>FrontNote is free software.</p>
 summary : <p>This project allow programmers to create plugins for Apple&#39;s Front Row 2.0, that was released with OS X 10.5 (Leopard) </p>

<p>Currently, its in a basic stage, only serving as an example of how to create plugins. </p>

<p>The only known working plugin currently is the FrontMyth plugin. The code for this is available in the examples area. </p>

<p>Future plans </p>

<p>Convenience classes to create recursive menus, and other simplifications. possibly support AppleTV. I do not have an AppleTV to test with, but since the py2app stuff seems to place all the support libraries for Python, this may work. I plan on buying an AppleTV in a few months to test, unless someone else takes up the cause. </p>

<p>A big thanks to the Sapphire group, who released their source code, which I heavily based this on.</p>
 title : The frontpython Open Source Project on Open Hub
 title : The frothing Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Frothing (Feed Reading On The Hoof) is a news aggregator for online news feeds. There are many other news readers available, but some are not available for mobile Linux devices or require many extra libraries to be installed. Frothing tries to fill this gap by creating a fast and easy to use news aggregator for mobile Linux handheld devices </p>

<p>InstallationFor now, to install Frothing you need to compile it inside a Hildon compatible desktop environment. To create such an environment have a look at the Moblin site or the Maemo site </p>

<p>Frothing was originally created for the Ubuntu Mobile Guide as an example of how to port an application written in C to the Ubuntu Mobile Edition. This guide is available online here and is good to read for background information. </p>

<p>	 </p>

<p>UME   Maemo        </p>

<p>Compiling from SourceEither check out the source from svn or grab the tarball to compile </p>

<p>The source can be checked out from the repositories by: </p>

<p>svn checkout http://frothing.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/ frothing </p>

<p>	 The tarball can be downloaded from the project page and extracted by:  </p>

<p>tar zxvf frothing-.tar.gz  
<br/>After unpacking/checking out the code, run the standard autotools commands inside your target:  </p>

<p>./configure --enable-hildon </p>

<p>make </p>

<p>make install		 </p>

<p>DependenciesOn Ubuntu the dependencies can be satisfied by: apt-get install libgtkhtml2-0 libgtkhtml2-dev libxml-perl libxslt1-dev libglade2-0 libglade2-dev libsqlite3-0 libsqlite3-dev libhildondesktop-dev xulrunner  </p>

<p>Maemo NotesThanks to Chris Malley </p>

<p>libgtkhtml2-0 and libgtkhtml2-0-dev are not available (yet?) in the maemo repositories so you need to apt-get the source from debian/ubuntu and build it inside scratchbox with --disable-accessibility  </p>

<p>Also you need to add </p>

<p>AC_CHECK_LIB(gthread-2.0, g_thread_init) </p>

<p>into configure.ac and do a aclocal/autoconf/autoheader/automake  </p>

<p>To Do- Create armel and X86 debs 
<br/>- Create Maemo One Click Installer</p>

 title : The fsch Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Flex Compiler SHell integration with Apache AntCurrent version 1.0.133  </p>

<p>Post your feature requests hereHow it worksDownload and install FCSHServer.  Set environment variable FCSHServer={application directory, e.g. C:\Program File\Fcsh Server\}.  Edit server.ini file: setup Flex SDK location (e.g. sdk=C:\Flex_sdk_3.0) or modify Flex Compiler SHell vmoptions Application directory contains fcsh.jar file. So example ant build.xml is: </p>

<p>    
<br/>    
<br/>        
<br/>            
<br/>        
<br/>    </p>

<p>    
<br/>        
<br/>            
<br/>            
<br/>            
<br/>        
<br/>    
<br/>fcsh has optional attribute consoleencoding (useful when error message text is not in English), default value is &quot;cp866&quot; for Cyrillic. Supported enodings. </p>

<p>Ant tries to connect to the FCSHServer (localhost:40000), on fail it tries to launch FCSHserver again, if connection fails after 5 retries BuildException is thrown. </p>

<p>All subsequent builds will reuse compiler cache. </p>

<p>c:\work\google.code\fcsh.ant\test&gt;ant
<br/>Buildfile: build.xml</p>

<p>build:
<br/>     [fcsh] Server is not responding. Probably it is stopped. Trying to launch...
<br/>     [fcsh] Server started
<br/>     [fcsh] Trying to connect... Attempt 0 of 5
<br/>     [fcsh] Server is up!
<br/>     [fcsh] Command: mxmlc -locale en_US -output=C:\realworld.swf -load-config+=C:\work\realworld\FLX\src\flex-config.xml
<br/>     [fcsh] fcsh: Assigned 1 as the compile target id
<br/>     [fcsh] Loading configuration file C:\work\3.3\frameworks\flex-config.xml
<br/>     [fcsh] Loading configuration file C:\work\realworld\FLX\src\flex-config.xml
<br/>     [fcsh] C:\realworld.swf (1072748 bytes)
<br/>     [fcsh] (fcsh)</p>

<p>     [fcsh] Awesome!</p>

<p>BUILD SUCCESSFUL
<br/>Total time: 8 seconds
<br/>c:\work\google.code\fcsh.ant\test&gt;ant
<br/>Buildfile: build.xml</p>

<p>build:
<br/>     [fcsh] Command: mxmlc -locale en_US -output=C:\realworld.swf -load-config+=C:\work\realworld\FLX\src\flex-config.xml
<br/>     [fcsh] Loading configuration file C:\work\3.3\frameworks\flex-config.xml
<br/>     [fcsh] Loading configuration file C:\work\realworld\FLX\src\flex-config.xml
<br/>     [fcsh] Nothing has changed since the last compile. Skip...
<br/>     [fcsh] C:\realworld.swf (1072743 bytes)
<br/>     [fcsh] (fcsh)</p>

<p>     [fcsh] Awesome!</p>

<p>BUILD SUCCESSFUL
<br/>Total time: 1 second
<br/>c:\work\google.code\fcsh.ant\test&gt;FCSHServer adds tray icon, right click to see menu: </p>

<p> 
<br/>About, shows status, version info  
<br/>Compiler cache, displays window where you can clean targets or recompile them manually  
<br/>View log, shows log file Exit, stops server</p>
 title : The FSHL Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>FSHL is a free, open source, universal, fast syntax highlighter written in PHP. A very fast parser performs syntax highlighting for few languages and produces a HTML output.</p>

<p>FSHL library is a simple, easy to use syntax highlighter. Its API provides only one method that is really need to highlight sources and three auxiliary methods to sets lexer and output mode.</p>

<p>FSHL core is very flexible and it is very easy to add new languages.</p>

 title : Page Not Found - Open Hub
 title : The fsm-trem Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>___         ___         ___     
<br/>                          /  /\       /  /\       /  /\    
<br/>                         /  /  \     /  /  \     /  /  |   
<br/>                        /  / /\ \   /__/ /\ \   /  / | |   
<br/>                       /  /  \_\/  _\__\ \_\/  /__/ /| |__ 
<br/>                      /  / /\ \   /__/\ \ \    \__\/_|    \
<br/>                     /__/ /\_\/   \  \ \/ /          /--/ /
<br/>                     \__\/         \  \  /          /  / / 
<br/>                                    \__\/          /__/ /  
<br/>                                                   \__\/   A tremulous project to improve, and create clients, and servers for the community to use at free will. This project was first started as a joint effort between Frak, Slacker, and Mercury to provide the community with high quality client and server builds. </p>

<p>Tremulous SVN revision this project is based on: SVN 1101 </p>

<p>ioquake3 SVN revision this project is based on: SVN 1514 </p>

<p>Getting startedWhen you first get the client, place it in the following locations. </p>

<p>Windows C:\Program Files\Tremulous and overwrite the current client. </p>

<p>Linux This location can vary, but most often is placed in /usr/local/games/tremulous. OS X /Applications/tremulous-20060625 folder, assuming you downloaded the client from Apple Downloads. After doing so, you may find some things different that you don&#39;t like, but don&#39;t know how to change them. If you have any problems, please check out the F.A.Q. Wiki, if you cannot find an answer to your question there, please contact a project member about your issue. </p>

<p>Community considerationWe will accept any code or ideas that you give us, as long as it agrees with the following rules. </p>

<p>The code or idea has to be within the limitations of our programming ability. The code or idea has to have a definite use, we will not accept silly functions that print &quot;hi im shooting you&quot; into the client. The code or idea cannot be a function to give a player an advantage over others in game, a.k.a. cheats. If the function has the possibility of being a cheat, then its use has to outweigh its cheating capability. If your code or idea agrees with the following, feel free to post an issue of your code of idea. We will most likely add it. </p>

<p>Why?When I first tried the game Tremulous I was pointed to the original TJW backport, I noticed some lacking features that I sometimes required. From there, I looked into how to compile a Tremulous client, and from then on I had added my own code and patches. I then wanted to start a client that gives the community the same options I had, for the ones that either don&#39;t have the skill or time to make their own clients. That is why Frak, Slacker, and me have all agreed to include any code or ideas that can pass the above rules. - Mercury </p>

<p>I have been doing my own client for a while with tw-clientserver  and just wanted a project with VOIP so i didn&#39;t have to type that much :) - Slacker </p>

<p>I&#39;m a feature-friendly person. Anything I create has to be as user friendly as possible, though in this case, its community friendly. Though the TJW client was great, I was excited of an idea that would actively include new bells and whistles. While Slack and Mercury do the under-the-hood work, I sit in the cab, waxing and polishing the inside, waiting to start the engine and sell the car. - Frak </p>

<p>Updating and version identificationCurrent codename: No Release Yet </p>

<p>To check if your client is out dated, follow these steps... </p>

<p>Open your client and press the ~ key(beside the 1, and above the TAB key) to open the console. Look towards the lower right hand corner of your console, look at the word in parenthesis. Compare the word with the one above, if they do not match, please update your client. After updating, your clients codename should match the one above. If not, please notify a project member.</p>
