 title : The genplus-gx Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>This is a port of Genesis Plus, an open-source &amp; portable Sega Mega Drive / Genesis emulator, originally developed by Charles MacDonald, now running on the Gamecube and Wii through libogc &amp; devkitpro. </p>

<p>Please note that this project is actually more than a simple port and the original core has been slightly modified: with respect to the initial goals, I focused myself on improving the emulator accuracy &amp; compatibility, as well as implementing new useful features and adding support for new peripherals and cartridges hardware. </p>

<p>The result is that Genesis Plus is now extremely close to the real thing, can run the entire Sega Genesis / Mega Drive game library and has nothing to envy to the most popular emulators on the PC platform. </p>

<p>The generic (multi-platform) code is maintained through the SVN repository so that other Genesis Plus ports can take advantage of it, and I hope this emulator can become a reference for open-source and accurate Genesis emulation. </p>

<p>Please read the Wiki or the included User Manual for more informations. </p>

<p> </p>

<p>For optimal experience, I&#39;d recommend using these Genesis/SMS adapters made by Raphnet technologies. </p>

<p> </p>

<p> If you like this project and would like to support it, you may donate via Paypal. All founds donated will be used to help further development by purchasing equipments such as additional controllers, debugging tools or Genesis development cartridge to run test on real hardware and improve emulator accuracy.</p>

<p>I&#39;m not a Gentoo developer and probably won&#39;t become one soon but I like writing ebuilds and think Erlang is cool. While perhaps a developer is willing to support this stuff, official inclusion in Portage is apt to take a while and this repository can perhaps accelerate the process.</p>

 title : The geolaunch Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>The idea is simple. We love web apps because they are flexible and powerful. We love geo-aware apps because they can do wonders with the location information. Can we mix them? Not in principle, since the browser will not give the webapp the lat and long. GeoLaunch is a the starting point to build geo-aware webapps. GeoLaunch is a native app that gets the location from the iPhone location services and then launches a browser with the location as the GET parameters. From then on the Webapp knows where the client is! This is great mod privacy issues.</p>

 title : The geoxml Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>GeoXml is a term coined by google themselves referring to Geospatial XML formats and the Google Maps API has its own tool for handling it. This project is a third party parser which can take its place and opens up the features to include more GeoXml formats and better OGC support... ie not just KML it also parses GML(such as produced by a WFS) and GeoRSS and GPX, its benefits include creation of collapsible tree based layer control (generally vertical in a sidebar).  It can also save out to its own kjson format (requires json.js or a browser with built in json toJSONString support). This parser in some cases actually handles kml created by Google Earth better than the API&#39;s GGeoXml. When a WMS base ground overlay is parsed in a kml it is auto-tiled as a GTileOverlay or GTileMapType making them first class citizens.   </p>

<p>I have posted this to better enable others to help contribute and fix bugs and track versioning and bug fixes.. ok the latter might be the biggest reason, anyway I have decided to publish this in a more visible public fashion. </p>

<p>I am mirroring the compressed version of the code on the downloads  page If you would like to look at the source in a more readable fashion check it out via svn (see the source tab).</p>

 title : The gestor-escolar Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Será um sistema web integrado ao site das instituições baseado em permissões, onde coordenadores, professores, pais e alunos terão níveis específicos de acesso de acordo com as suas necessidades. Dados os níveis de acessos, vamos descrevê-los: </p>

<p>•Professores: Responsáveis pelo envio de notas e presenças dos alunos, também poderão enviar avisos para pais e alunos, terão acesso a um ambiente de criação de exercícios e simulados on-line, além de enviar materiais complementares para as turmas, assim como a resolução de provas anteriores. 
<br/>•Alunos: Terão acesso a um banco de dúvidas, onde poderão consultar as dúvidas já existentes, como também poderão enviar suas dúvidas para que possam ser respondidas pelos professores, existirá um acompanhamento de seu desempenho durante o ano letivo, onde poderão consultar suas notas, faltas e um gráfico demonstrando o andamento de cada aluno. Além disso irão verificar o horário das aulas, realizar avaliação dos professores, e participarão de fóruns de discurssão. 
<br/>•Pais: Os pais poderão imprimir os boletos da mensalidade escolar diretamente do sistema, além de verificar as notas e faltas de seus filhos, notificação de professores e coordenadores sobre o desempenho do aluno ou possíveis eventos a serem realizados, além de ter acesso ao calendário de provas e verificar os horários. 
<br/>•Coordenadores: Serão responsáveis por enviar ao sistema o calendário escolar, enviar avisos para pais, alunos e professores, cadastrar novos eventos, efetuar a transferências de alunos, acompanhamento do desempenho de cada aluno e também das turmas em geral através de gráficos. 
<br/>•Diretores: Basicamente mesmo nível dos coordenadores, porém com uma visão geral de todas as séries, e não apenas de uma turma específica como os coordenadores. Além de acompanhar as avaliações dos professores realizadas pelos alunos, e um sistema de BI para acompanhamento do faturamento da instituição. 
<br/>Além dos tópicos específicos, o sistema contará com uma biblioteca on-line, e futuramente será implantado uma automação da parte de matrículas e gerenciamento da instituição.</p>

 title : The get-high Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>When completed this will be a game in which you guide a balloon up through a maze of dangers.  One control style will be clicking the mouse near the balloon.  The mouse click creates a radial force that pushes the balloon away.  You can use this technique to keep the balloon from touching anything dangerous.  The other control style I would like to implement is to use the motion sensor on a macbook or macbook pro.  By turning the computer you move the entire game board thus allowing the balloon to float up and escape. </p>

 title : The getodo Open Source Project on Open Hub
 title : The getoptpp Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>This is yet another C++ version of the getopt function, that is, for parsing command line options and environment variables. However, unlike other versions, the design goals of this one are: </p>

<p>EASY to use EASY to learn mimc STL&#39;s streams minimum code to type smooth integration with STL types Platform independant (ANSI C++) EASY to extend for your own types That is, you just construct a GetOpt_pp object with argc and argv, and then extract the options with the &gt;&gt; operator as an istream :) </p>

<p>Example: We want to receive two options, one for an int (say, named -i and --test1), and another for a float (named -f and without long option). Results in test1 and test2 vars. </p>

<p>int main(int argc, char* argv[])
<br/>{
<br/>        using namespace GetOpt;
<br/>	int test1 = 10;
<br/>	float test2 = 3.14f;
<br/>		
<br/>	GetOpt_pp ops(argc, argv);
<br/>	
<br/>	ops &gt;&gt; Option(&#39;i&#39;, &quot;test1&quot;, test1) &gt;&gt; Option(&#39;f&#39;, test2); 
<br/>	
<br/>	std::cout &lt;&lt; test1 &lt;&lt; &quot;\n&quot; &lt;&lt; test2 &lt;&lt; &quot;\n&quot;;
<br/>	return 0;
<br/>}See the project&#39;s Wiki for documentation. </p>

<p>Current version: 2.13 </p>

<p>Coming soon: environment stream for inserting and extracting env vars! </p>

<p>Don&#39;t miss GetOpt_pp Episode 3! </p>

<p>This project belongs to FuDePAN.</p>

<p>RoadmapRecord high scores Allow choosing level Options, such as assigning keys Insert junk rows Online battle Instant messaging Migrate to Griffon when it is mature enough Get InvolvedFeel free to join the project! Email me if you want to participate.</p>
 title : The getris Open Source Project on Open Hub
 title : The gettestfire Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Because you&#39;re lazy, too. Web application testing for real world projects.Intuitive, fast test creationTestFire combines a FireFox extension, a management server and a distributed Agent to allow you to create, manage and run large numbers of complex unit tests quickly and, hopefully, with as little pain as possible. This is web developement; there&#39;s always some pain.  </p>

<p>Create sets of test via the TestFire extension and upload them directly to a centrally managed repository, managed by the TestFire server and a web interface.  Direct a test to be run either immediatly, or on a repeating schedule The use of Agents allows for distribution of the individually slow (but not computationally intense) Watij-based unit tests, allowing a single commodity-level PC to run multiple Agents via the use of virtualization.  Testsets can be created and run directly on a single machine, with only the TestFire Agent and Extension, allowing for validation of tests under construction, and, for smaller projects, as the entire testing platform. Current State of DevelopmentTestFire is currently in need of alpha testers and additional developers. There is a strong and significant framework in place, but many features need to be fleshed out, error catching written, I18N implemented, etc. </p>

<p>Those with a strong background in Javascript would find themeselves quite welcome in aiding in the development of the Extension module. Typical web applications developers would be incredibly welcome in the Server module, and those that just want to dable and learn from a large, fairly well organized code base are welcome to poke and prod wherever they may.  </p>

<p>Developer Friendly: A note from the creatorA primary goal of mine in developing this framework (until I fell massively behind at any rate), was to make the project developer friendly; this means a sophisticated build/install system, logical division of code structure, comments, and most importantly a willingness to help those who wish to further this project. So feel free to jump in, no matter what your skill level. While I may not have as much time to aid those who need help unrelated to this project, where I am able I will be glad to help you help this project. </p>

<p>The modules that make up TestFireTestFireExtension: The Firebug Extension that is the test creation front-end to the TestFire web application testing environment. TestFireModel: The Model definition that TestFire relies on to construct and parse testsets.  TestFireSupport: Support files for creating the development environment and generally making developers lives easier. TestFireAgent: The Agent, a local interface between the Extension and the Mangement Server. Also capable of supporting single user testing directly, with the Extension as a front-end.  TestFireServer: The Management Server front end to managing web applications tests, enterprise wide. IMPORTANT LICENSING NOTEDue to the lack of a Project -&gt; module hierarchy on source hosting sites (such as Google Code), and a lack of a multiple licensing scheme here at Google Code, this project is listed as being Licensed under the Mozilla Public License, 1.1. this is the case for ONLY the TestFire Extension module, which utilizes code from the (awesome) Firebug extension.  </p>

<p>The other modules are all listed under the MIT License. See the licensing information in each module folder for more information.</p>
 summary : <p>This project is a basic getting started project for GraniteDS remoting server with flex on the client side and Spring/Hibernate stack on the backend. This project has two modules one java server and flex client.</p>

 title : The gg-ui Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Great GUI with Google Guice and other Good Stuff...Project created on 24th Mar 2008. </p>

<p>At this point, this project is nothing more than a learning exercise for me. I would attempt to create something useful through it, but no promises. </p>

<p>Next (Initial) Release?No plans yet... </p>

<p>DetailsIt&#39;s darn hard to build rich client applications from raw swing wedgets, but all the frameworks out there doesn&#39;t quite do it for me either. This project is a personal endeavour  to create a framework that I would actually enjoy using. </p>

<p>Design PrinciplesInstead of describing what that is, I&#39;ll just make a few generalised statements about myself. I think they will be reflected in my choices in design and code. </p>

<p>I believe in Agile principles (DRY, YAGNI, convention over configuration, testing, incremental releases...) I am a fan of ruby, rails and dynamic languages. I code mostly in java but I wish I could have some ruby-like language features... I&#39;m writing this thing for myself, I&#39;ll solve the problems I want to solve first then we&#39;ll see. Design GoalsMinimal yet powerful API, takes advantage of static typing but dynamic whenever appropriate. No boiler plating necessary, it should be easy to stay DRY. Encourage good design, making it virtually impossible to mix business logic with UI. Offer clean interface with back-end, for integration and testing benefits. It should be easy to unit test UI components. Development effort should be proportional with application complexity, easy to get something simple going and add complexity as needed.  The &quot;Hello World&quot; demo should be under 20 lines of concise code. Technology Choices(at time of project creation) </p>

<p>Dependency Injection with Google Guice. Utilities and components from Spring-richclient project Swinglabs (swingx) wedgets JGoodies binding</p>

 title : The ghunter Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>ghunterEver since I saw pcman’s XD Programming, </p>

<p>I have been practicing using glade to work on a picture-watching program. </p>

<p>The habit that I have of reading comic books. </p>

<p>Designing a handy program for reading comic books on my own. </p>

<p>I participated in CMake sometime before, thinking I am unfamiliar with autotools, </p>

<p>and why not take this chance to learn CMake? </p>

<p>Therefore, I have created this version. </p>

<p>v 0.0.5 (2008/12/05)  </p>

<p>add f to fullscreen &amp; q to exit program add use key to scroll image  Fix issue - slideshow can&#39;t zoom fit Fix issue - rotate Add feature - zoom in &amp; out (code not yet) </p>

<p>v 0.0.4 (2008/11/22)  </p>

<p>Fix issue - reopening images can&#39;t be correctly Add best fit Modify briefing to slideshow, and &quot;10 secs&quot; to &quot;03 secs&quot; Add logo file (design by bow: http://www.ismall.com.tw/qpainter_view.php?id=5&amp;mode=1&amp;page=1) Make deb package for lenny </p>

<p>v 0.0.3 (2008/05/31)  </p>

<p>Multilingual  Solutions to the absence from glade </p>

<p>v 0.0.2.5 (2008/04/06)  </p>

<p>Change to cmake Some easy installments for modification of .h  </p>

<p>v 0.0.2 (2007/10/13)  </p>

<p>Fix the already-known bug of 0.0.1 Drastic modification of program (since I am not familiar with glade, I misuploaded items.) New function for briefing (1 sec、 5 sec、 10 sec, respectively.) Support the operation of keyboards.  </p>

<p>v 0.0.1 (2007/10/08)  </p>

<p>Normal fit No more scrollbar, and you can move the location for pictures directly. Contained with functions of opening table of contents and preview after opening files. Use roller to control the change of page. The next page after the final one is the first page, and vice versa. Pushing the middle button comes full screen.  </p>

<p>Installment instructions: </p>

<p>source code:http://ghunter.googlecode.com/files/ghunter_0.0.5.tar.gz 
<br/>$ wget http://ghunter.googlecode.com/files/ghunter_0.0.5.tar.gz 
<br/>$ tar xf ghunter_0.0.5.tar.gz 
<br/>Please install cmake first. (ex. aptitude install cmake) 
<br/>Then disclose the file, operating 
<br/>   </p>

<p>$ cd ghunter-0.0.5 
<br/>   $ cmake . </p>

<p>$ make 
<br/>$ sudo make install 
<br/>or  
<br/>  </p>

<p>deb file:http://ghunter.googlecode.com/files/ghunter_0.0.5-1_i386.deb </p>

<p>$ wget http://ghunter.googlecode.com/files/ghunter_0.0.5.tar.gz 
<br/>$ sudo dpkg -i ghunter_0.0.5-1_i386.deb 
<br/>This way, everything will be solved.</p>
 title : The gi-torrent Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>The goal of the project is to build a GUI for rTorrent  based on the Tibco GI framework and document the XML definitions for the XMLRPC interfaces needed to call the services. The usage will probably be limited to remote administration over HTTP, so f.i. running rTorrent on NLSU2 with lighttpd as a web server. You need to run a version of rTorrent compiled with XMLRPC enabled, see rTorrent XMLRPC guide. Second step is setting up your webserver for XMLRPC, see WiKi.  </p>

<p>The big advantage is that there is no (giTorrent) code running on the rTorrent machine. Once the giTorrent is loaded, it uses XMLRPC calls to rTorrent that use very little resources on the rTorrent server machine. You can find installation instructions for local install and webserver install in the Wiki pages. An attempt at a user manual is available at the Wiki. </p>

<p>giTorrent Live! </p>

<p>For the lazy ones out there,I have created a web page on a free hosting network that starts giTorrent, so you do not have to install. Downside is : </p>

<p>these free providers have variable uptime they can disable the account without reason they have a download limit they have variable performance (mostly sluggish) this mode requires specific browser settings (see Wiki)  this mode does not allow you to change the initial connection settings </p>

<p>Cool, at least you can checkout the new version before downloading it. </p>

<p>giTorrent Live! (@110Mb) </p>

<p> </p>

<p>Tibco GI is an opensource AJAX framework that provides GUI functionality combined with connectivity to services and a XSLT like mapper. More information on Tibco GI can be found at Tibco GI Devnet. </p>

<p>(Tibco GI is distributed under the BSD Open license, not GPL)</p>

 title : The gisgraphy Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Gisgraphy is a free and open source framework. Its goal is to provide tools to use free GIS Data on the Web. Actually it manage Geonames and OpenStreetMap (34 million entries). it provides an importer to inject the data into a strongly typed Postgres / Postgis database and use them via webservices : worldwide geocoding, worldwide reverse geocoding, fulltext and find nearby.Results can be output in XML, Atom, RSS, JSON, PHP, Ruby, and Python. Here are the main functionalities :  </p>

<p>Importers for Openstreetmap data in csv format Importers from geonames CSV files, reporting of inconsistencies and a report when import is complete. Just give the country(ies) you wish to import and / or the placetypes, and Gisgraphy download the files  and import them with all the alternateNames (optional), and sync the database with the fulltext search engine REST Web Services   Full text search  (based on Lucene / Solr  with default filters optimized for city search (case insensitivity, separator characters stripping, ..) via an Java API or a webservice 
<br/>An admin interface Fully replicated / scalable / high performance / cached services Findnearby function (with limits, pagination, restrict to a specific country and/or language and other useful options) via a Java API or a Web Service Search for zipcode or name Several output formats supported : XML, json, php, ruby, python, ATOM, GEORSS... Dojo widgets / prototype / Ajax to ease search but can be use it even if javascript is not enabled on the client side Plateform / language independent because of webservices Provides all the countries flags in svg and png format more... Note that Gisgraphy is under the LGPL license V3 and the Geonames data are under the creative commons attributions license</p>

 title : The git-svn-py Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Git is an open source version control system designed to handle very large projects with speed and efficiency, but just as well suited for small personal repositories; it is especially popular in the open source community, serving as a development platform for projects like the Linux Kernel, Ruby on Rails, WINE or X.org. </p>

<p>Subversion is an open-source revision control system, which aims to be a compelling replacement for CVS </p>

<p>git-svn is script to bidirectionally manipulate svn repository in git way. </p>

<p>Currently the official git-svn is implemented in perl. It makes extensive use of fork/exec, which makes it a CPU-hog on msysgit/Widnows. Also, it requires msys version perl, which is not easy to compile. The target of this project is to reimplement git-svn in python, by using the official python interpreter(published by python.org or provided by distributions). When importing svn repository to git, git-fast-import is used, which eliminates fork/exec&#39;s at each revision.</p>
 summary : <p>Gizz is Red5 open source media server (osflash.org/red5) port to Ruby. It is available under GPL2 license and offers Flash video streaming capabilities as well as recording and real-time data interchange. </p>

<p>Thanks to Ruby, applications can be modular and include plugins, use ActiveRecord to access the database and so forth.</p>

 title : The glasgow-green-map Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>We are developing a web based &#39;Green Map&#39; for Glasgow, Scotland.  The Green Map initiative aims to help people develop eco-friendly maps, both paper- and web-based, to help people make the the best use of the reuse facilities in their city.  There is already a paper-based Glasgow green map in production and we aim to leverage it with this addition community resource. </p>

<p>The online map will be a system relying on the Google Maps API (though the code will make this interchangeable with other online mapping sites).  We aim to have a very visual searchable interface where members of the community can search within their designated areas. The map is initially aimed at the poorest demographic in Glasgow.  As this map is being developed as part of a community effort it will be licensed under an open source licence. </p>

 title : The glaze Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>A game and physics engine for Flash including: </p>

<p>Rigid Body Dynamics Scene management Line of sight User Input Scrolling AI Core parts of the physics solver and collision system are based on the C physics engine Chipmunk </p>

<p> </p>

<p>DevelopmentApart from the conversion from C to AS3 and OOP, many adaption have be made to tune the engine for the performance characteristics of the AVM2.  In summary: </p>

<p>The original relies heavily on memory operations &amp; copy/update arrays for many things - especially contact lists.  Array operations (splicing, adding/removing elements) is expensive in this situation.  AVM2 Optimization All these arrays were replaced with linked lists</p>
 title : The glint-ui Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Glint is an open-source UI framework developed primarily for use in C++ applications. It is bulit around the concept of &quot;UI Node&quot; which can form a &quot;UI tree&quot;. On that tree, Glint performs layout (computing required sizes and setting final bounds of nodes), drawing (recursive compositing with transform and clip support), input handling (converting input in events and traversing the tree to deliver the events), focus handling (for keyboard input and to provide visual cues) and animations support (for transitional animations). </p>

<p>To illustrate the difference from other UI frameworks, here are main design principles of Glint: </p>

<p>1. Small and fast, compiled from source and statically linked with the app. No separate distribution, no DLLs, reg entries, dirs etc. A small static lib. </p>

<p>2. Does not use ATL, MFC, COM, Boost and uses very little C++ features like templates to make it readable as much as possible and easy to compile into application&#39;s project. </p>

<p>3. It is not all things for all the people - but it is so simple that all people can add things they want. Basically, it can be thought as a good place to start and then customize. </p>

<p>4. No pre-packaged hi-level controls like listboxes or tabbed panels. Glint has Node, ImageNode, NineGrid, SimpleText, Button, Row, Column and some other types of nodes. Not even editable text control although this can change in the future.</p>
 summary : <p>Glista aims to be a very simple personal to-do list manager that does what it&#39;s supposed to, and does not get in your way. </p>

<p>The main focus of Glista is on staying a very simple tool. We believe task tracking is a trivial part of our daily work (or life) and that it should stay trivial. </p>

<p>Technically, Glista is written in C and uses the Gtk+ grapical toolkit and Glib, making it potentially cross-desktop and cross-platform.  </p>

<p>Currently it is known to runs on different flavours of GNU/Linux, but should be easily portable to other UNIX-like systems, and also to Mac OS X and Microsoft Windows.</p>

 summary : <p>This is a web based filename repository for the files on your removable media (CD/DVD) or filesystem. This way you know what files you have and where they are. Filenames can be seen only by you or can be shared. Every file/directory/program/software/image/music,... can have description/tag People can search through all the shared filenames in repository You can let others to copy (take) your shared files (Future Enhancement) People can sell/buy the shared files (Future Enhancement) You can upload the actual files like a normal file hosting (Future Enhancement)</p>

 title : The globalite Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>GlobaLite is meant to be a breed of the best i18n /l10n plugins available for Rails. (compatible with Rails 2.1) </p>

<p>NOTE: GlobaLite is NOT yet compatible with Rails 2.2 Edge. I worked with the i18n team to create Rails i18n/l10n API but I didn&#39;t port GlobaLite yet. I didn&#39;t even start working on that. GlobaLite is NOT thread-safe and might have issues if used in Rails 2.2 </p>

<p>LATEST UPDATES:  </p>

<p>Nov  13 2008: added Greek Dimitrakopoulos Nov  13 2008: added Arabic (Egypt) Mosta Sept 29 2008: added Danish Hoeg Sept 5  2008: added Ukrainian Prihodko Sept 5  2008: added support for labels Sponagl July 30 2008: Globalite now works with plugin_paths. nmerouze July 30 2008: fixed improper handling of multiple pluralizations in a single string morhekil July 30 2008:added custom inflectors support morhekil July 30 2008:updated Russian language file Philippov July 17 2008: improved Turkish language file and resource path localization Torun June 16 2008: Added Malagasy + new rake task creating and/or appending all non-translated symbols from views , helpers &amp; controllers to the org_base file. June 2 2008: Added Finnish, Serbian and Turkish + tested against Rails 2.1 May 16 2008: Added support for Russian, Argentinean Spanish, Dutch + fixed a #select_month bug May 14 2008: Added support for Polish + validation error localization (GitHub only) May 13 2008: Rails 2.1rc1 compatible + support for Hungarian. (available only @ GitHub) May 1 2008: GlobaLite example app moved to GitHub: http://github.com/mattetti/globalite-example March 4 2008: GlobaLite is moving to GitHub: http://github.com/mattetti/globalite/tree/master  git clone git://github.com/mattetti/globalite.git 
<br/>I&#39;ll keep the repo in sync for a little while until I totally switch to git. Feel free to fork github and send me pull requests. </p>

<p>Sept 2nd 2007:  Added Chinese localization thanks to Ivan Chang Added pluralization support Added ActiveRecord error message localization Updated the sample application August 16th 2007: Added German Localization thanks to Ralph von Der Heyden!  August 1 2007: updated the French translation(Alexandre Bournier), reverted the recent change to the model error msg handling since it doesn&#39;t seem stable July 31 2007: Added better model error localization name translation contributed by Guillaume Belleguic July 2 2007: SAMPLE Application now available: http://www.railsontherun.com/2007/7/2/globalite-sample-application                         </p>

<p>Globalite offers  </p>

<p>easy UI localization.  Rails localization.  user content available in multiple languages. Active Record validation localization </p>

<p>Simple UI localization support different locales yml file based simple syntax no setup needed enough for most projects needing localization pass variables to the localization and let the translator deal with it Simple Rails Localization support different locales nothing to do, rails comes in your own language (including currency conversion and other helpers) yml file based localization for easy update support for Rails 1.2x simple to maintain simple to add/edit a new locale Resource routes get translated Built-in Rails localization in: English (UK) English (US) French (FR) Spanish (Spain, Argentina) Italian Portuguese (Brazilian and Portuguese - thanks to Marcus Derencius) German (Germany) (thanks to Ralph von Der Heyden) Chinese(CN, HK, TW) Hungarian Polish Russian Dutch Finnish Turkish Malagasy Ukrainian Danish Greek Arabic Go to http://www.railsontherun.com/globalite for more info and news </p>

<p>Submit your language file in your own language to Matt Aimonetti: mattAimonetti@gmail.com</p>

 title : The glu Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Rich UI, Windows Vista integration. Needs .NET 3.5 SP1 (http://www.microsoft.com/downloads/details.aspx?familyid=ab99342f-5d1a-413d-8319-81da479ab0d7&amp;displaylang=en) You don&#39;t need to download it separately because it is now handled by the installer.</p>
 summary : <p>GLU: GENOTYPE LIBRARY AND UTILITIESWhole-genome association studies are generating unprecedented amounts of genotype data, frequently billions of genotypes per study, and require new and scalable computational approaches to address the storage, management, quality control, and genetic analysis. GLU is a framework and a software package that was designed around a set of novel conceptual approaches. GLU addresses the need for general and powerful tools that can scale to effectively handle trillions of genotypes. </p>

<p>Key innovationsCompressed binary genotype storage Data sets are usually not loaded into main memory unless absolutely necessary.  Instead many of the analytical functions read the data in small chunks, perform the requested analysis, then move on to the next. Integration with a high-level scripting language for easy customization and extension Support for parallel processing and distributed computing (more on this in later versions) Data management featuresThe ability to import, export, merge, and split genotype data among several common formats and standards Filter based on powerful criteria for inclusion, exclusion Rename and adjust sample and locus metadata Genotype quality assuranceEstimation of assay completion and other summary statistics Reproducibility and concordance Verification of known and detection of unknown duplicate samples Empirical sex determination Testing for deviations from Hardy-Weinberg proportions, Mendelian inheritance patterns, non-random patterns of missing data. Analytic toolsFitting generalized linear models to test for phenotype/genotype association Fast linkage disequilibrium (LD) estimation Fast tag SNP estimation with the ability to augment SNPs from set panels with a optimal tag SNPs using flexible criteria including design scores from major genotyping vendors. ExtensibilityViewed as a library or framework, GLU is designed to be highly extensible, so that it may be easily augmented, customized, and serve as a foundation for the rapid development of new applications. </p>

<p>License InformationGLU is released under a modified BSD license </p>

<p>Documentation (still a work in progress)GLU 1.0b1 Documentation </p>

<p>GLU 1.0b2 Development Documentation </p>

<p>CommunityGLU users group for discussion and help with GLU GLU developer group for those involved in improving and extending GLU AcknowledgmentsGLU is primarily developed and maintained by Kevin Jacobs  to support the Cancer Genetic Markers of Susceptibility (CGEMS) project, an initiative by the National Cancer Institute (NCI) Division of Cancer Epidemiology and Genetics (DCEG) and run by the NCI Core Genotyping Facility (CGF) to identify genetic alterations that affect susceptible to prostate and breast cancer. </p>

<p>CGEMS is funded by NCI under Contract N01-CO-12400 by SAIC-Frederick, a subsidiary of Science Applications International Corporation (SAIC). </p>

<p>Contributors</p>

<p>Glue consists of a number of libraries to provide you with the basic infrastructure for your application: logging, configuration, plus sane and simple data access. </p>

 title : The gm-sqlite Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>A really simple Lua interface for use with Garry&#39;s Mod. </p>

<p>SyntaxThe module creates a global table called &#39;sql&#39;. It has 2 member functions. </p>

<p>local results = sql.Query( &#39;SELECT * FROM sometable&#39; )</p>

<p>if ( results  ) then</p>

<p>   foreach id, row in pairs( results ) do</p>

<p>      Msg( row[ &#39;username&#39; ], &quot; = &quot;, row[ &#39;email&#39; ], &quot;\n&quot; )</p>

<p>   end</p>

<p>else</p>

<p>   Msg( &quot;Error Running Query: &quot;, sql.LastError(), &quot;\n&quot; )</p>

<p>end</p>

 title : The gmail-pdf-rails Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Envia email a través de gmail generando y adjuntando un PDF / Rails</p>
 summary : <p>Gmail Notifier, a KDE 4 plasmoid
<br/> </p>

<p>TOC: Features · Download · Screenshots · Feedback ·  Trademark notice </p>

<p> </p>

<p>FeaturesGmail Notifier: </p>

<p>Supports multiple Gmail accounts and labels Shows notifications whether new e-mails arrive. Supports Gmail hosted domains </p>

<p> </p>

<p>DownloadBuild and installationWARNING: Please make sure you installed all the required development packages and/or libraries suitable for your distribution! If it don&#39;t build, chances are the problem is on your side or, although I always try to commit code that compiles, you&#39;re very unlucky and you&#39;ve just fetched the source code while it&#39;s broken. If so, try a previous revision until the problem is fixed in HEAD. So please, don&#39;t file an issue unless you&#39;re really sure it is a problem with Gmail Notifier! </p>

<p>The latest code (in trunk/) will only work with KDE &gt;= 4.2.0. If you wish to give it a try, just follow these steps: </p>

<p>$ svn co http://gmailnotifier.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/ gmailnotifier
<br/>$ cd gmailnotifier
<br/>$ mkdir Build; cd Build
<br/>$ cmake .. -DCMAKE_INSTALL_PREFIX=`kde4-config --prefix` -DCMAKE_BUILD_TYPE=Debugfull
<br/>$ make
<br/>$ sudo make install
<br/>$ kbuildsycoca4 # Shouldn&#39;t be necessary but won&#39;t do any harmIf you use KDE &lt; 4.2.0 you&#39;ll have to stick to rev. 59 (which is quite buggy but should work on most setups), do: </p>

<p>$ svn co -r59 http://gmailnotifier.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/ gmailnotifier
<br/>$ cd gmailnotifier
<br/>$ mkdir Build; cd Build
<br/>$ cmake .. -DCMAKE_INSTALL_PREFIX=`kde4-config --prefix` -DCMAKE_BUILD_TYPE=Debugfull
<br/>$ make
<br/>$ sudo make install
<br/>$ kbuildsycoca4 # Shouldn&#39;t be necessary but won&#39;t do any harmNote: The above commands will fetch, build AND install Gmail Notifier on your system. </p>

<p>UpdateTo update the code to the latest revision do: </p>

<p>$ cd /path/to/gmailnotifier
<br/>$ svn update
<br/>$ cd Build
<br/>$ cmake .. -DCMAKE_INSTALL_PREFIX=`kde4-config --prefix` -DCMAKE_BUILD_TYPE=Debugfull
<br/>$ make
<br/>$ sudo make installNote: The above commands will build Gmail Notifier in full debug mode. Replace &quot;-DCMAKE_BUILD_TYPE=Debugfull&quot; with &quot;-DCMAKE_BUILD_TYPE=Release&quot; if you don&#39;t need this (but note that if you find a bug or something it is usually helpful to have some debug output to submit with your bug report). </p>

<p>Uninstallation$ cd Build/
<br/>$ sudo make uninstall
<br/>$ kbuildsycoca4 # Shouldn&#39;t be necessary but won&#39;t do any harmNote #1: There are no tarballs available! Code is only available through the SVN repo.
<br/> Note #2: Please keep in mind that this is development code. Don&#39;t be surprised if you hit some nasty bugs or your computer orders some pizzas without your knowledge :). In other words: use it at your own risk! </p>

<p> </p>

<p>ScreenshotsNote: The following screenshots may not reflect the current state! </p>

<p>Gmail Notifier placed on the desktop + configuration dialog </p>

<p> </p>

<p>Gmail Notifier placed in a panel </p>

<p> </p>

<p>FeedbackHave an idea? Feature request? Improvement Request? Patch? File a feature request! </p>

<p>A problem? Bug? Any kind of weird behavior? File a defect report! </p>

<p>You should check the already opened issues before. Perhaps your problem was already reported by someone else. </p>

<p>Note #1: Please, please, please! Before filing a defect report (especially reports saying you can&#39;t build Gmail Notifier), make sure you installed all the required development packages/libraries suitable for your system/distro. Since I&#39;m only using one single distro, I&#39;ll be glad to hear what are the necessary packages for the distro you&#39;re using (drop me an e-mail), I&#39;ll then add this to that page.
<br/> Note #2: If you made a patch that you would like to see included in Gmail Notifier&#39;s codebase, please don&#39;t send it to me by e-mail. Instead, use the issue tracker so that other people can comment, star, etc... your work. Thanks! </p>

<p> </p>

<p>Trademark noticeThis project is neither endorsed, nor sponsored by, nor affiliated with Gmail®. Gmail® is a registered trademark of Google Inc.
<br/> Google™ is a trademark of Google Inc.</p>

 title : The gmap-viewer Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>A stand-alone Java/Swing application that allows the user to view Google Maps and stores them locally on the user&#39;s computer.</p>
 title : The gmapcatcher Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>OverviewGMapCatcher is an offline maps viewer. It downloads CloudMade, OpenStreetMap or Google Map tiles automatically, display them using a specific GUI. User can view the maps while offline. GMapCatcher doesn&#39;t depend on google-map&#39;s java scripts so it should work even if google changes them. It also provides a downloading tool. </p>

<p>GMapCatcher is written in Python 2.6, can run on Linux, Windows and Mac OSX. </p>

<p>   </p>

<p>You can find a list of improvements and latest features in the Changelog </p>

<p>Downloadhttp://gmapcatcher.googlecode.com/files/GMapCatcher-0.6.3.0.tar.gz </p>

<p>or </p>

<p>$ svn checkout http://gmapcatcher.googlecode.com/svn/trunk gmapcatcherFor Windows users, get the latest Windows installer </p>

<p>Usagemaps.py is a gui program used to browse google map. With the offline toggle button unchecked,  it can download google map tiles automatically. Once the file downloaded, it will reside on user&#39;s hard disk and needn&#39;t to be downloaded again any more. At release 0.02, it use multi-threaded downloader and can be faster. </p>

<p>After version 0.04, user can force GMapCatcher to re-download old map tiles by checking &quot;Force update&quot;. If a tile is older than 24 hours, it will be re-downloaded. </p>

<p>download.py is a downloader tools that can be used to download google map&#39;s tiles without gui. maps can use files it downloaded without configuration.  </p>

<p>Below is an example using download.py: </p>

<p>$ download.py --location=&quot;Paris, France&quot; --max-zoom=16 --min-zoom=0 --latrange=2.0 --lngrange=2.0Files$HOME/.googlemaps/*DependenciesWindows users are highly recommended to download the latest Windows installer. This installer contains all required packages, works well on Win 2K, XP, Vista and Win 7. For a complete list of tested OS, see wiki Tested Operating Systems. </p>

<p>If you choose the tarball (because you have a legacy Windows like Windows 98), you must install Python 2.6, GTK+ for windows, pygtk, pygobject and pycairo yourself. </p>

<p>Currently GMapCatcher also depends on Python Imaging Library (PIL). For gentoo users, emerge dev-python/imaging. </p>

<p> </p>

<p>Authorpi3orama@gmail.com, HelderSepu@gmail.com, Maxim.Razin@gmail.com, standa31415@gmail.com</p>
 title : The gmaps-api-issues Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>This project is a place to report and track issues with the Google Maps API. Some handy links for each API are below.  </p>

<p>Javascript Maps APIBrowse the list of  Bugs,  Feature Requests. File a  Bug, Feature Request. Read the Changelog. </p>

<p>Static Maps APIBrowse the list of Bugs,  Feature Requests. File a  Bug, Feature Request Read the Changelog. </p>

<p>Maps API for FlashBrowse the list of   Bugs,  Feature Requests. File a  Bug, Feature Request. Read the Changelog. </p>

<p>MappletsBrowse the list of  Bugs,  Feature Requests. File a  Bug, Feature Request </p>

<p>Geocoding APIThese are issues with the HTTP Geocoder and manifest themselves in all APIs that use it. (Javascript, Flash, Mapplets). </p>

<p>Browse the list of   Bugs, Feature Requests. File a Bug, Feature Request </p>

<p>Maps Data APIThese are issues with the Google Maps Data API, the HTTP API that lets you store and update maps stored on Google servers. </p>

<p>Browse the list of   Bugs, Feature Requests. File a Bug, Feature Request </p>

<p>Javascript API v3These are issues with the Google Maps Javascript API v3, which is currently in labs. </p>

<p>Browse the list of  Bugs,  Feature Requests. File a  Bug, Feature Request. Read the Changelog. </p>

<p>Puppet tests for regressionPuppet is a new framework for testing web applications in Javascript. It replaces Selenium as our regression test suite before release. </p>

<p>Run  tests. Browse  tests. File a Bug,</p>

<p>.gadget-title {
<br/>  margin-bottom: 2px;
<br/>}</p>

<p>function resizeIframeHandler(opt_height) {
<br/>  var elem = document.getElementById(this.f);
<br/>  if (!elem) return;
<br/>  if (!opt_height) {
<br/>    elem.style.height = undefined;
<br/>  }
<br/>  else {
<br/>    opt_height = Math.max(10, opt_height);
<br/>    elem.style.height = opt_height + &#39;px&#39;;
<br/>  }
<br/>}
<br/>gadgets.rpc.register(&quot;resize_iframe&quot;, resizeIframeHandler);</p>

<p>gadgets.rpc.regis</p>

 title : The gmlive Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>GmockGmock is a mocking framework for the Groovy language. </p>

<p>Gmock is all about simple syntax and readability of your tests so you spend less time learning the framework and more writing code. To use Gmock just drop the gmock jar file in your classpath. </p>

<p>The current version is gmock-0.8.0 and is packed with tons of feature. </p>

<p>Checkout our official site at gmock.org and our documentation to get the full picture. Visit our roadmap to see what&#39;s coming next. </p>

<p>Getting StartedFirst extend the org.gmock.GMockTestCase. Create mock object using the mock() method. You setup expectation simply by calling method on your mock. </p>

<p>def mockLoader = mock()
<br/>mockLoader.load(&quot;fruit&quot;).returns(&quot;apple&quot;)The code you are testing should be executed within the play closure.  </p>

<p>void testBasic(){
<br/>  // create mock and setup expectation
<br/>  play {
<br/>    // run your code
<br/>  }
<br/>}In A NutshellMethod mocking: mockLoader.load(&quot;fruit&quot;).returns(&quot;apple&quot;) Exception mocking: mockLoader.load(&quot;unknown&quot;).raises(new RuntimeException()) Stub mocking: mockLoader.load(&quot;fruit&quot;).returns(&quot;apple&quot;).stub() Static method mocking: mockMath.static.random().returns(0.5) Property mocking: mockLoader.name.returns(&quot;loader&quot;) Constructor mocking: def mockFile = mock(File, constructor(&#39;/a/path/file.txt&#39;)) Partial mocking: mock(controller).params.returns([id: 3]) Times expectation: mockLoader.load(&quot;fruit&quot;).returns(&quot;apple&quot;).atLeastOnce()   Custom matcher: mockLoader.load(match{ it.startsWith(&quot;fru&quot;) })   Strict ordering: ordered {  ... } Optional support for Hamcrest matcher: mockLoader.put(&quot;test&quot;, is(not(lessThan(5)))) GMockController if you can&#39;t extend GMockTestCase in your test    </p>

<p>Here is a full example: </p>

<p>import org.gmock.GMockTestCase</p>

<p>class LoaderTest extends GMockTestCase {
<br/>  void testLoader(){
<br/>    def mockLoader = mock()
<br/>    mockLoader.load(&#39;key&#39;).returns(&#39;value&#39;)
<br/>    play {
<br/>      assertEquals &quot;value&quot;, mockLoader.load(&#39;key&#39;)
<br/>    }
<br/>  }
<br/>}</p>

 title : The gneve-webma-dev Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>gnizr™ (gə-nīzər) is an open source application for social bookmarking and web mashup. It is easy to use gnizr to create a personalized del.icio.us-like portal for a group of friends and colleagues to store, classify and share information, and to mash-it-up with information about location. It&#39;s free.  </p>

<p>Image Matters LLC contributed gnizr to the Open Source community, and continues to support its development as part of its gnizr Enterprise software.  </p>

<p>NEWS (10/09/2008): We need your help .. read this  NEWS (07/15/2008): Gnizr 2.4.0-RC1 is now available for download. Are you doing an upgrade? Read this.   NEWS (05/09/2008):  Welcome to gnizr.com -- a free gnizr service.  NEWS (03/27/2008): Gnizr 2.3.0 Final Release is now available for download.  </p>

<p>Feature HighlightsArchive saved bookmarks and organize bookmarks using tags and folders. Edit notes using WYSIWYG bookmark editor. Assign geographical location values to bookmarks and view them on a map. Define relationships between bookmark tags -- broader, narrower and member-of. Tag bookmarks using Machine Tags. Super fast bookmark search using Lucene. Search bookmarks and other sites simultaneously using OpenSearch. View bookmarks in Clustermap and Timeline. Import new bookmarks from user-defined RSS subscriptions -- RSS, Atom and GeoRSS. Create new application behaviors using gnizr API. For example: Add modules to support custom Machine Tags; Add listeners to handle bookmark change events; Develop custom RSS crawlers to perform automated bookmark imports; and Create third-party mashups from data published by gnizr (RDF, RSS and JSON). ScreenshotsSee gnizr screenshots on flickr. TechnologyBuilt-on Java Servlet technology (WebWork + Spring) Front-end pages are written using the Freemarker template language MySQL backed database. All database operations are implemented as stored procedures. Semantic tag relationships are modeled based on the SKOS ontology. Supports various metadata output format: GeoRSS, RDF (SIOC + Tag Ontology), RSS, Timeline XML and Clustermap XML. Geocoding machine tag uses Geonames web service. Full-text search engine built-on Apache Lucene API. Open search interface and Firefox search plugin built-on the OpenSearch standards. CreditOur Atlassian FishEye hosting is kindly provided by Atlassian.  </p>

<p>Need to gnize your Enterprise? Ever wanted to bookmark and mashup your enterprise content as easy as gnizing the web? Then you need gnizr Enterprise. IM is the leading provider of social bookmarking and web mashup of Enterprise content. Founded by the creators of gnizr open source, the world&#39;s most reliable open source social bookmarking and web mashup platform, Image Matters delivers enterprise-class support and development to help you unlock your Enterprise silos.</p>
 title : The gnizr Open Source Project on Open Hub
 title : The gnome-menu-file-browser-applet Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>About File Browser AppletFile Browser Applet is an applet for the GNOME Panel. It lets you browse and open files in your computer directly from the panel, without having to open a file manager. It is not intended as replacement to proper file managers like nautilus. Sometimes you just want to open a file and don&#39;t want to have to open a file manager, browse to and open the file, then close the file manager. This Applet just saves you couple of clicks. </p>

<p>NOTE 1: From now on .Deb packages will be created and hosted here </p>

<p>NOTE 2: As of version 0.5.5 this project has been renamed. If you&#39;re installing from source, It is recommended that you completely uninstall any installed versions older than 0.5.5 before installing this one! </p>

<p>Version 0.6.5Fixed &amp;nbsp;bug #69&amp;nbsp; (thanks to Ivan Baldo for report and fix). Fixed &amp;nbsp;bug #71&amp;nbsp;. Fixed issue described by pedrib in bug #48 (but is not actually bug #48). FeaturesBrowse and open files in your computer from the panel. Respects GNOME mime type options and includes mime icon in menu. Middle clicking (or pressing F4) in a directory header will open a terminal in that directory. Middle-clicking (or pressing F4) on file will open with the configured editor, right-clicking will execute the default action (including running binary or .desktop files). Configuration options (directories and labels to show, select icon, show/hide icon, show hidden, select terminal and editor). Support for .desktop files. Displays message for empty directories or failure to open a directory. Optional keyboard activation (Super+h). Context menu with some useful actions such as open-with, new folder here, delete file/folder, create/extract archive, etc. Fast keyboard navigation via mnemonics. Drag &#39;n Drop from applet to Nautilus or Desktop to MOVE files. Opened files added to &quot;Recent Documents&quot; list. Optionally displays a file&#39;s thumbnail if it exist. Screen Shots </p>

<p> </p>

<p> </p>

<p>InstallingUsingToDo and Planned FeaturesHelp is welcomed for addressing any of the following: </p>

<p>Translation. Drag-n-drop configuration. Documentation A better icon. Generating distribution packages. </p>

<p>BugsYes! Plus lots of memory leaks. Report bugs using the bug tracker in this site. </p>

<p>HackingContributions are welcome, but it might take a while for them to make it into a release as I (unfortunately) don&#39;t always have a lot of time to devote to this project (and other lame excuses). Send ideas/code/patches via the bug tracker.</p>
 title : The gnome-mplayer Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>A GTK2 interface to MPlayer. The power of MPlayer combined with a friendly interface for your desktop; You can play all your multimedia (audio, video, CD, DVDs, and VCDs, streams etc.), organize, sort and create playlists, take screenshots while playing videos, be notified about media changes. Full DVD and MKV chapter support, when supported by Mplayer. Subtitle support with the ability to specify preferred audio and subtitle languages if the media supports it. Support for cover art retrieval from Amazon.com for audio media files with artist and/or album information contained in the file. </p>

<p>The player can be used to play media on websites from your browser when used with Gecko Mediaplayer and is the modern replacement for the mplayerplug-in application. </p>

<p>Gnome MPlayer has a rich API that is exposed via DBus. Using DBus you can control a single or multiple instances of GNOME MPlayer from a single command. </p>

<p>Gnome MPlayer is not dependent on any Gnome libraries. However. the look and feel of the application is based on the Gnome HIG. The main dependency is on GTK2, GLIB2 and DBUS.</p>
 summary : <p>Global Menu Bar for GNOME</p>

<p> 28 new GlobalMenu strings to translate !. It&#39;s easy to translate, you can get started in 5 minutes and make a difference using Launchpad. </p>

<p> </p>

<p> </p>

<p> </p>

<p>Global Menu is the globally-shared menu bar of all applications launched in your desktop session. </p>

<p> </p>

<p>This project introduces document-oriented concepts into GNOME, and improves GNOME&#39;s respect for Fitts&#39;s law. Most GTK applications work just fine with Global Menu. See ApplicationCompatibility for a list of them. </p>

<p> </p>

<p>There are several advantages by adopting a shared global menu bar in Gnome (thanks Matthew for organizing these):  </p>

<p>It works better with narrow windows, because the width of the menus isn&#39;t limited to the width of the window. (This is a problem for Gimp and Inkscape especially.) It&#39;s less confusing -- when two menu bars are visible on-screen at once, sometimes people choose the wrong one. Global Menu is the first step to move toward a Document Centric Desktop Environment ( ThoughtsOnADocumentCentricGnome ) which is, according to us, a long-term trend in DEs. </p>

<p>Show your support for GlobalMenu by voting it up in Ubuntu Brainstorm </p>

<p> </p>

<p>DevelopmentSee: DevelopmentHome 
<br/>InstallationSee: Installation 
<br/>LinksThe Bug corresponding to the inclusion of a global menu in GNOME. It was opened by Aqd and has the old version of the patch. It keeps track of any progress, and of a future inclusion as an hidden option in GNOME.  </p>

<p>http://bugzilla.gnome.org/show_bug.cgi?id=353076 </p>

<p>The Ubuntuforums.org thread started by Aqd to keep track of the development and to provide technical support. It is the major source of knowledge, tips and tricks, patches on the subject. It has been partly summarized in the Wiki but would need further synthetization. It is now the home of further development by rainwoodman. It is more than 150 pages long. </p>

<p>http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=241868 </p>

<p> </p>

<p>THIS IS NON-WARRANTED SOFTWARE. USE AT YOUR OWN RISK. IT KILLS KITTENS AND COMPUTERS TOO</p>

 title : The gobblerss Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>GobbleRSS is a web-based RSS reader inspired from the previous version of Google Reader.</p>

<p>It was developed as an alternative to Google Reader for people who need to access their RSS articles from home or work, but with the possibility to download unread articles to a PDA.
<br/>Since Google Reader doesn&#39;t yet have a public API that would allow a PDA to grab the latest unread articles, GobbleRSS was developed to allow PDA sync applications to download a single web page that contains a certain number of unread articles. You can then read those articles on the go.</p>

<p>If you find articles that you&#39;d wish to review later, simply note the articles ID that appear next to the articles title on your PDA. When you&#39;re in front of your computer, simply enter the numbers you&#39;re interested in reviewing in the GobbleRSS web form.</p>

<p>GobbleRSS allows you to star articles, and share your starred articles using your own RSS feed.
<br/>It also has a &#39;Keep Unread&#39; feature.</p>

 summary : <p>My programs/applications/tools all about iPod and iPhone., </p>
 title : The goldenak-bot Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>The GoldenAK Bot is an all purpose Java bot, primarily designed to output everything what happens in an Call of Duty 4 server into an IRC channel. We mainly create the bot for that, but thanks to modules, many other purposes are possible too. </p>

<p>The sourcecode is pretty well documented, with a piece of text above almost every method and property to indicate what it&#39;s meant to do. This way, we want the project to be accessible by as many people as possible. </p>

<p>Current featuresAlthough this bot is still in pre-alpha stage (compiled .jar files are available when we feel like it), it is already usable and quite stable. Currently the CoD4EchoHandler module and the Connect module (which handles NickServ identification and joining channels after connect) are the only fully working and useful modules. This is because we&#39;re focussing on adding features to the bot and the CoD4EchoHandler. </p>

<p>Recently, support for timers became reality. This, in combination with the ModuleManager and the BotManager, will give you a pretty powerful bot framework in Java. At the moment though, there are no modules around which make use of the timer functionality, but we hope that&#39;s going to change soonish. </p>

<p>Also, all bots are now managed by using the new BotGroup class. A BotGroups is an object which bundles a bunch of bots, after which several operations can be done on either all of the bots or distributed over them. There are also a couple of methods to filter bots, so you can get a new BotGroup with only the bots you need. </p>

<p>CoD4EchoHandler </p>

<p>Supports logfiles over FTP, so the bot doesn&#39;t have to run on the same server as the Call of Duty 4 server. This module is currently undergoing a bit of a recode, and therefore there&#39;s not a lot of functionality, but once it&#39;s running, produces a nice echo including parsed map names, gamemode names, weapon names and body part names (where the last bullit hit when the player got killed). All this uses colors to differentiate the information in the messages easily. </p>

<p>Colors in player names are converted to mIRC compatible colorcodes as well. The number of kills and deaths is maintained and shown in the !players command. Anyone can use !msg to talk to the players ingame as well. </p>

<p>For people with halfops or higher in the IRC channel, the keyhashes are visible when a player joins the server, just as the teamchat.  </p>

<p>In the future we are planning to add admin commands, such as !kick, !(temp)ban, !rcon, and probably more. Other future features include customizable weapon names (for mods), customizable messages (if you don&#39;t like our template that much), and much much more. </p>

<p>Features currently being worked onAfter a long time of inactivity around this project, we&#39;ve decided to pick it back up again. This started off with a big code clean up which includes improving documentation and rewriting code to perform better. </p>

<p>This has completed for the most important bits of the program, and the rest will be done while new features are being added. </p>

<p>If you want to see the bot in action, join us on #LVP.CoD.echo on GTANet (irc.gtanet.com).  </p>

<p>We will continue development to hopefully one day release version 1.0!</p>

 summary : <p>using adobe air.  make music player, </p>

 title : The google-api-adwords-python-lib Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Google&#39;s AdWords API service lets developers design computer programs that interact directly with the AdWords platform. With these applications, advertisers and third parties can more efficiently -- and creatively -- manage their large or complex AdWords accounts and campaigns. </p>

<p>AdWords API Python Client Library makes it easier to write Python clients to programmatically access AdWords accounts. </p>

<p>FeaturesSupport for SOAPpy and ZSI web services toolkits SOAP layer is hidden from end user Support for PyXML, ElementTree, and lxml to parse SOAP XML messages Outgoing and incoming SOAP messages are monitored and logged on demand Response headers (i.e. responseTime, units, requestId, etc.) are logged on demand Support for API calls to production system or sandbox Automatic data type conversions for all API call parameters Tracking of all API usage Report downloading in XML or CSV formats Ability to post raw XML messages Compatible with Google App Engine Thread-safe Docs Updates</p>

<p>02/16/10  Python client library v10.0.0 released: Removed support for v200906, patches, and more 01/21/10  AppEngine demo v2.3.0 released: Upgraded to Python client library v9.0.0 and more 01/21/10  Python client library v9.0.0 released: Support for SOAPpy+v2009 and more </p>

<p>-- AdWords API Team</p>
 summary : <p>Google&#39;s AdWords API service lets developers design programs that interact directly with the AdWords platform. With these applications, advertisers and third-parties can more efficiently - and creatively - manage their large or complex AdWords accounts and campaigns. </p>

<p>The AdWords API Ruby Client Library makes it easier to write Ruby clients to programmatically access AdWords accounts. </p>

<p>Want to stay up-to-date with our latest releases? Subscribe to the downloads update feed. </p>

<p>FeaturesSupport for logging incoming and outgoing SOAP messages Support for logging request information Support for API calls to the production or Sandbox environments Support for tracking API unit usage Report downloading in XML and CSV formats Extensions for returning breakdown of API usage per client account or API method Utility methods for retrieving lists of commonly used codes (categories, countries, etc.) Local validation for parameter number and type on API calls RDoc documentation and unit tests Thread-safe Note: if you&#39;re looking for examples of how to use this library, they&#39;re included with the tarball and also available on the repository. You can find them at http://code.google.com/p/google-api-adwords-ruby/source/browse/#svn/trunk/examples </p>

<p>--AdWords API Team </p>

<p>Updates</p>

<p>Feb 17, 2010  Version 18.0.0 released: Removed support for v200906, made app. tokens optional.   Jan 22, 2010  Version 17.3.0 released: Added some functionality tests for v2009, minor bugfixes.   Dec 10, 2009  Version 17.2.0 released: Added new set of code samples for v2009.   Nov 25, 2009  Version 17.1.0 released: Added support for AdParamService, improved logging.</p>

<p>Provides simple, unofficial, .NET Framework APIs for using Google Ajax RestFULL APIs (Search API, Language API etc.) </p>

<p>Google Translate API for .NET 0.3 alphaDescription:  </p>

<p>Provides a simple, unofficial, .NET Framework API for using Google Ajax Language API service. </p>

<p>Feature: </p>

 summary : <p>Provides a simple, unofficial, Java client API for using Google Translate. </p>

<p>Install </p>

<p>Simply include the google-api-translate-java.jar file in your application&#39;s classpath. </p>

<p>Quickstart </p>

<p>This is our &quot;Hello World&quot; example: </p>

<p>import com.google.api.translate.Language;
<br/>import com.google.api.translate.Translate;</p>

<p>public class Main {
<br/>  public static void main(String[] args) {
<br/>    try {
<br/>      String translatedText = Translate.translate(&quot;Salut le monde&quot;, Language.FRENCH, Language.ENGLISH);
<br/>      System.out.println(translatedText);
<br/>    } catch (Exception ex) {
<br/>      ex.printStackTrace();
<br/>    }
<br/>  }
<br/>}Well done. You&#39;re now an expert in using this API! The wiki has a more complete example usage within a desktop application. </p>

<p>Features </p>

<p>Automatically throttles repeated queri</p>
 title : The google-api-translate-java Open Source Project on Open Hub
 title : The google-app-engine-django Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>This project provides a helper that eases the process of creating a Django project to run on the Google App Engine. </p>

<p>The helper currently provides: </p>

<p>The ability to use most manage.py commands A BaseModel class that appears the same as the standard Django Model class. The ability to serialize and deserialize model instances to JSON, YAML and XML. Access to Django&#39;s test framework with a test datastore and support for fixtures. The ability to send email via the App Engine mail API using the standard Django mail functions. An App Engine compatible implementation of the Django authentication framework. Only users are supported at this time. Group and Permission support is not implemented. Support for the Django memcache cache backend module. Support for the db and cache session backed modules when using Django 1.0 alpha. </p>

<p>This is an initial release of the helper and we look forward to working with the community to extend the functionality it provides. </p>

<p>For more details and to get started please refer to the  introductory article or the README. </p>

<p>If you are upgrading from an earlier version of the Google App Engine Helper for Django you may be interested in the list of recent CHANGES. </p>

<p>To Submit Your Patch to the helperTo submit a patch to the helper </p>

<p>Locate or Create a bug for the issue you wish to patch Post the code for the patch in the issue If the patch is accepted, we&#39;ll mark it as such (set the status as Patch-Accepted) When the version of the helper with your accepted patch is released, we&#39;ll mark the issue as Fixed-Patch  To Submit a Feature or IssueTo submit a feature: </p>

<p>Check if the feature already exists in the issue tracker If it does, star the issue If you have additional clarification, add that to the comments If the feature does not exist, file a new feature including a description of the desired functionality  To submit a potential issue: </p>

<p>Check to see if the issue exists If it does, star the issue If you have additional information on the issue, add that to the bug  If the issue does not exist File the issue. Please include as much specific detail as possible when reporting the bug. Include any stack trace that you see, and if appropriate screenshots of the observed behavior</p>
 summary : <p>An adaptation of the Guestbook sample SDK that uses the Django web framework, and doubles as an easy starting point for your own Django applications on the Google App Engine.</p>

<p>No assembly required. </p>

<p>Google App Engine exposes a fully-integrated development environment. </p>

<p>It&#39;s easy to scale. </p>

<p>Google App Engine makes it easy to design scalable applications that grow from one to millions of users without infrastructure headaches. </p>

<p>It&#39;s free to get started. </p>

<p>Every Google App Engine application can use up to 500MB persistent storage and 5 million monthly page views.  </p>

 title : The google-apps-for-your-domain-ldap-sync Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Featuressynchronizes users from Active Directory or openldap into Google Apps detects new and exited users automatically and changes Google Apps accounts accordingly handles user id / account renames automatically handles attribute updates automatically keeps track of changes and only propagates deltas (to allow syncing every 10 minutes for example) This tool uses an API that is deprecated (see GData Provisioning API 1.0).  You might want to consider using the following alternative: </p>

<p>Google Apps Directory Sync </p>

<p>InstallationBe sure you have Python 2.4 or later installed. </p>

<p>Download a read only copy of ldap-sync with </p>

<p>svn checkout http://google-apps-for-your-domain-ldap-sync.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/ google-apps-for-your-domain-ldap-sync 
<br/>You can also download the tarball if you prefer. </p>

<p>You must use the python client of the Google Apps provisioning API v1.0.  To download a copy use  </p>

<p>svn checkout http://google-apps-provisioning-api-client.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/python google-apps-provisioning-api-client 
<br/>or download the latest provisioning api python client library. </p>

<p>Be sure to set your PYTHONPATH to the root of where the python client library is loaded (there should be a google/appsforyourdomain subfolder below wherever PYTHONPATH points if you&#39;ve done it correctly). </p>

<p>Finally, download and install the latest python-ldap from sourceforge. </p>

<p>UsageSee the document How to Use It</p>
 summary : <p>Google Apps domain administrators can use the Provisioning API v1.0 client libraries to manage their user accounts, nicknames and email lists. </p>

<p>The Provisioning API v2.0 client libraries are included with the Google data API client libraries.</p>
